title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Fixed term\* / full time

* *offered on a Definite 12 month contract basis.*

**Location:** The successful candidate may be based in one of the following locations: Brazil, the Netherlands Finland, Denmark, Sweden and Norway.

**We offer competitive NGO level salary and benefits, the specifics of which depend on the location where the successful candidate will be based. We aim to share this information with candidates before reaching the offer stage.**


Greenpeace International (GPI) is looking for an **Analytics Engineer** to play a crucial role in our Technology Department - enhancing the performance, cohesion, and alignment of our entire global network and supporting our mission to achieve a green and peaceful future through strategic technology and data solutions.


The Technology Department delivers technology and data solutions that enable the Greenpeace network to win campaigns, faster, and to support an effective and efficient global organisation through the massive strategic uplift that technology can give us:

* Where all teams are supported by technology that is aligned to their needs, enabling them to have their greatest impact.
* Where change agents’ power is amplified through Greenpeace’s technology.
* Where our relationship with technology and data reflects our values and our mission to achieve a green and peaceful future.


You will contribute to the design, development, and automation of global data pipelines and analytic services. Your work will facilitate secure, scalable, self-service data and insights work across Greenpeace International.

**In this role you will:**

* Collaborate with data engineers, analytic engineers, the Data Platform product team, and other global data team members.
* Work with colleagues across Greenpeace to design and maintain scalable data solutions using dbt and cloud-based tools (such as BigQuery)
* Contribute to the design and development of a global, standardised data framework that supports consistent, reliable insights across the Greenpeace network.
* Contribute to the Global Data Strategy, including creating frameworks, standards, and principles for data architecture.
* Lead the secure and efficient transfer of data across departments, ensuring clear management of data flows.
* Provide expert input and strategic advice to various teams and projects at Greenpeace International.
* Address complex software and data system design challenges.
* Ensure data projects meet key data management standards, security, data curation, deduplication, and automation.
* Support the maintenance and documentation of data pipelines.
* Maintain high-quality coding standards and provide system support.
* Create high-quality documentation for existing data engineering modules, including non-technical audience architecture diagrams.

**For further information about this role, please see the full job description by clicking** **HERE****.**

 **What we’re looking for:**


Remember no one has every skill or experience needed for this role and you’ll have the opportunity to learn a lot from the team. We believe someone who has a few of these is well suited to exceed in this role:

* Extensive depth and breadth of experience as an analytics engineer, including expertise to lead projects and design without supervision.
* A postgraduate qualification or equivalent professional accreditation in Computer Science (or related field) and significant experience in software development, data engineering, or analytics engineering.
* Strong experience delivering transformation pipelines using dbt.
* Strong experience delivering cloud-based engineering solutions; specific experience on Google Cloud Platform is desirable, including:


	+ BigQuery and data warehouse design patterns,
	+ Serverless compute, including Cloud Run and Google Cloud Functions,
* Proficiency in Python & SQL.
* Strong problem-solving abilities.
* Excellent technical and end-user documentation skills.
* The ability to communicate effectively with non-technical audiences.
* Proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
* Demonstrable support for and belief in the Greenpeace network core aims and values.

**What you can expect:**


You’ll be encouraged to develop both personally and professionally, taking advantage of the wide range of learning and development opportunities available to our staff. Staff can also access our wellness initiatives, such as yoga and meditation and also have the opportunity to join our global Equity, Diversity & Inclusion staff communities.

 **Please click** **HERE** **to visit the careers site,** to learn more about working for Greenpeace.

**About us:**  

*Greenpeace is a global campaigning network. It comprises 26 independent national/regional organisations, and a coordinating organisation, Greenpeace International. Greenpeace uses peaceful, creative confrontation to expose global environmental problems, and develop solutions for a green and peaceful future.*


Our goal is to ensure the ability of the earth to nurture life in all its diversity. That means we want to:

* protect biodiversity in all its forms
* prevent pollution and abuse of the earth’s ocean, land, air and fresh water
* end all nuclear threats
* promote peace, global disarmament and non-violence

**To Apply:**


If you share our vision, please click **'apply for this job'** below, to begin your application.


To apply for this role, we require you to answer a selection of key criteria and upload your CV (**in English**) via our online application form.


Addressing the key criteria is an important part of your application. We will be looking for evidence that demonstrates your skills and experience in these areas. Use examples where possible, to draw attention to experience, knowledge, achievements and skills gained in past employment or voluntary/leisure activities, provided they are relevant to the post.

***At GPI, we understand the benefits of using open AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT), however for the purpose of this application we prefer to see answers that were tailored by candidates themselves, without relying too much on these tools, so we can get a good impression on your thinking.***


It’s advisable to prepare your responses to the key criteria before starting your online application, as you are unable to save and return to it at a later date.


If you have any questions about this vacancy or the application process, please email us at recruitment.int@greenpeace.org. Please note that all applications have to be filled out via the website and can't be submitted via this email.

*We welcome everyone to apply for our positions. We understand that some candidates hesitate to apply unless they meet 100% of the criteria. However, we strongly encourage you to apply if you meet some of the key criteria for our roles. We’d love to know how your unique experience can bring value to our team. We believe in people power and having representation from many different communities to effect change.*

*Greenpeace International is an equal opportunity employer with a longstanding commitment of providing a work environment that respects the dignity and worth of each individual. We recognise and value the benefits and strengths that diversity brings to our employees and the whole organisation and we thrive in an environment that encourages respect and trust. We do not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship, colour, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation and would like to invite you especially to apply!*

***CLOSING DATE****:* **Sunday November 16 2025, 23:59 (CEST)**

title: Erfaren Salesforceutvecklare
description:
* Ansök senast: 30 november 2025
* Stockholm
* Hybrid
**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------

Vill du vara med och vidareutveckla vår Salesforceplattform? Vi söker en erfaren Salesforceutvecklare som vill vara med på resan när vi tar plattformen till nästa nivå.


**Ditt team**  

Du blir en del av ett team som består av Salesforce utvecklare, Business Analyst, Testare, Product Owner och Team Coach. Tillsammans ansvarar teamet för att leverera funktionalitet som stödjer Handelsbankens CRM-lösning baserad på Salesforce. Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och du kommer samarbeta nära andra utvecklare och arkitekter, inom och utanför vårt område. Vi har roligt på jobbet och vårt team präglas av hög kompetens och bred erfarenhet inom både teknik och affärsverksamhet.


**Din roll**  

Som Salesforce utvecklare kommer du att vara en del av ett högpresterande team där innovation och problemlösning står i fokus. Du kommer tillsammans med teamet ta fram och utveckla tekniska lösningar enligt Salesforce best practise. Vi drivs av att testa nya saker och se hur vi kan ta in dessa i våra leveranser. Teamet kommer översätta strategiska verksamhetsmål till IT-lösningar, säkerställa riskhantering och att lösningar uppfyller regelverksefterlevnad, samt säkerställa kvalitet och effektivitet på leveranser.


**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

* Tjänstepension
* Vinstdelningssystem
* Gruppförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Bidrag vid föräldraledighet
* Banktjänster
* Banking services
* Benefit in connection with parental leave
* Health promotion subsidy
* Group insurance
* Occupational pension
* Profit-sharing scheme
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

**Din profil**  

Vi söker dig som är utvecklare och har gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling och implementation av Salesforce. Du kan arbeta självständigt och har god förståelse och erfarenhet av olika Salesforce produkter. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla användarorienterade, effektiva, och skalbara Salesforce applikationer enligt bästa praxis i den senaste tekniken.


Det är meriterande om du tidigare arbetat med Marketing Cloud eller Data Cloud då vi nu håller på att titta på nästa del i resan, *Market Automation och AI.* Eftersom vi samarbetar med hela koncernen krävs goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


Vi söker även dig som har:


* erfarenhet av att implementera Lightning Components, Flows, Apex Controllers, Batch Apex, Schedulers och Apex Triggers
* kunskap om att integrera Salesforce med externa applikationer med hjälp av tredjepartsverktyg via SOAP och REST API-integration
* certifieringar inom Salesforce tex Salesforce Administrator, Plattform Developer 1, Sales cloud och Service cloud
* varit involverad i större implementeringar av Salesforce i en stor organisation

Som person strävar du efter att arbeta tillsammans med ditt team så att ni gemensamt kan komma fram till de bästa lösningarna och nå uppsatta mål. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och hjälper till där det behövs. Det kommer naturligt att tänka i nya banor för att komma till skalbara lösningar. Du håller dig uppdaterad kring det senaste inom ditt område och omvärldsbevakar för att söka efter bästa möjliga lösningar.


**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

*Som ett steg i Handelsbankens rekryteringsprocess krävs en godkänd bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat, utförd av en extern part, innan anställning kan ske.*

**Kontaktuppgifter**

**Rekryterande chef:** Fredrik Rutberg, fredrik.rutberg@handelsbanken.se & Ann-Chistine Stålfors, ann-christine.stalfors@handelsbanken.se
  

**Talent Acquisition Partner:** Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:** Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se
  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** Paul Gutesten, paul.gutesten@handelsbanken.se


  
**Om företaget**
----------------

Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.


Vi har ett unikt sätt att bedriva bank som bygger på en stark tilltro och respekt för den enskilda människan. Våra värderingar och starka företagskultur har en avgörande betydelse för vår framgång och guidar oss om hur vi uppnår våra mål, samarbetar och stöttar varandra. Genom stark lokal förankring, ett decentraliserat arbetssätt och ett långsiktigt perspektiv skapar vi hållbara relationer genom livets olika skeenden. Hos oss på Handelsbanken är alla viktiga. Vi kommer från olika platser med olika bakgrund, erfarenhet och utbildning. Tillsammans är vi Handelsbanken.  



  

Mer om Handelsbanken Mer om Handelsbanken

TOM En av världens starkaste banker

title: Chief Operating Officer
description:
Aura Cloud is a class leading cloud platform for financial institutions to launch and run their business at light-speed. Our platform is at the centre of our customers’ digitization path and business critical. We provide 24/7 platforms for critical core financial applications that require a very high degree of quality and stability of the platform.


We are fast expanding into other markets with continued focus in the Nordics. We seek an experienced **COO** to join the management team at our **Stockholm** office, to accelerate and manage our growth.

**The Role**


As the Chief Operating Officer, you will lead the entire Operations Team for the organization and be responsible for the success of our customer’s and our business operations. You will lead define and run out operating model, lead our customer engagement and project teams, plan and manage operational deliverables and controls as part of the management group devising and executing our growth strategy.


**Your Skills / abilities**

* You are a person with an entrepreneurial mindset with a passion to find optimal operating models that ensure sustainable business growth with proven ability to manage gross margins in a growing SaaS business
* You have at least 15+ years of experience in Bank and Finance domain with a minimum of 10 years in leadership positions in banking operations.
* You have good domain knowledge on consumer and SME banking with knowledge of banking processes.
* Proven operational excellence in ensuring high SLA compliance for internal or external customers in a financial organization setup.
* Experience in IT infrastructure oversight from an Operational point of view preferably handling ITSM and IT infra directly or indirectly.
* Hands on knowledge on cost optimization techniques of Cloud infrastructure
* Knowledge on Six Sigma / Lean methodologies for operational excellence and Agile (Scrum / Kanban) / PRINCE2 project management methodologies
* Knowledge on banking compliance – GDPR / PS Directives / DORA among others
* Understand and assess Risks and provide feedback to Development / Customer Success Teams to protect our customers’ assets.
* Defining and optimizing SDLC and Support life cycle to suit internal business model and customer success metrics
* Complete understanding of Service orchestration capabilities and Day 2 operating models for financial institutions
* You can simplify complex ideas and communicate them in diagramming /writing with clear logical thinking.
* You are people-oriented person who builds strong relationships with customers and stake holders.
* You are a person who can connect with the team, identify their strengths and weaknesses, align the team to realize our vision.
* Thought leadership in current and emerging aspects of Agentic frameworks and how then can deliver exponential value to our customers will be desired.
* You are fluent in English as the working language; knowledge of other European languages is a plus.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Do you want to work with cutting-edge Nvidia and AI technology?


Great, we are strengthening our team to architect and operate AI supercomputers securing Ericsson’s AI leadership.  

These new supercomputers are extremely fast and draw huge amounts of power, testing the limits of power distribution, liquid cooling, network & storage capacity


Join us and shape Ericsson in the age of AI.

 **What you will do:**


In this role, you will join our group of skilled and multi-functional teams. In addition, you will have the opportunity to:

* Act as main technical interface for stakeholders and development teams at an architecture and design level
* Lead the work together with other architects to ensure end-to-end architectural integration.
* Follow a requirement-based approach and architectural system design for the network and network security domain.
* Contribute to the creation of cost-effective solutions through activities in design, planning and deployment.
* Develop and use pro-active measures to maintain a stable environment and optimize when necessary.
* Contribute to implementing continuous improvements by collecting users’ feedback.
* Be an advisor during a Root Cause Analysis (RCA) related to failed deliveries and incidents.
* Apply requirements engineering’s standard methodologies during system design and aligning to Ericsson’s requirements engineering processes.

 **The skills you bring:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent hands-on experience).
* Relevant certifications (at least one): Juniper (JNCIA/JNCIS/JNCIP) or NVIDIA networking certifications (Cumulus/BlueField-related, if available)
* Strong experience with Juniper routing, switching, and security platforms such as MX, QFX, and SRX.
* Proficient in network design, configuration, and troubleshooting within large-scale environments.
* Strong understanding of cloud networking concepts including overlay/underlay, VXLAN, and EVPN.
* Skilled in TCP/IP, BGP, EVPN, MPLS, and QoS protocols.
* Experienced in network monitoring, performance tools, and automation using Python, Ansible, or similar scripting languages.
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting abilities with ability to work in cross-functional teams.

  

A safety interview may be required for final candidates in this process

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Linköping

title: (Associate) Microsoft Systems Technical Service Manager – based in Luxembourg
description:
***This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.*
 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Information Systems Directorate (GIS), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Infrastructure Services Division (IS), UC & Windows Client Services Unit (UCWS) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) Microsoft Systems Technical Service Manager\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Engineer IT Tech & Infra


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from September 2025.*
 Purpose
   

  

 You will manage the technology roadmap, design, and delivery of projects, as well as the daily operations for Windows Operating System Servers. Your role will be key in aligning technology solutions with the organisation's needs and contributing directly to the achievement of the EIB's strategic objectives
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 As a Microsoft Servers Systems Technical Service Manager, you will be part of the UC & Windows Client Services Unit within Infrastructure Services Division. You will be responsible for providing senior technical expertise and leadership in support for Windows Operating Systems.
   

  

 The successful candidate will report to the Head of UC & Windows Client Services Unit
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Deliver projects and manage the Windows Servers daily operations with the support of a team of consultants and / or a managed services provider
* Create, maintain a technology roadmap for Windows Operating Systems Servers in a context of fast automation and digitalisation of EIB activities
* Maintain Windows Services, address vulnerabilities in collaboration with IT Security Unit, manage patching campaigns and upgrades to ensure compliance
* Assess impact of releases, features or changes on the IT environment and advise relevant stakeholders on a recommended approach
* Work closely with development, engineering, support, infrastructure, and business operations teams to drive problems and incident resolution
* Provide risk mitigation measures, maintain systems compliance and address audit findings
* Contribute to the execution of Windows Services disaster recovery, business continuity requirements and capacity plans
* Actively propose ideas of improvement and optimisation for the existing processes and services and then track their development and implementation
* Ensure that projects and processes are managed properly and that solutions are designed and implemented in line with internal policies, procedures and that best practice, security recommendations and industry standards are respected
* Provide advice, in consultation with various IT teams in the context of projects and act as a change owner to introduce innovative approaches within the Bank’s IT solutions


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related disciplines
* Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Windows system administration, including troubleshooting, performance optimization, and implementing new solutions.
* Experience with tools such as MECM, Intune, SCOM, and Active Directory / Entra ID (including Group Policy management).
* Experience contributing to IT infrastructure projects or upgrades, ideally involving new technology rollouts.
* Experience with PowerShell scripting skills for automation and system administration tasks.
* Understanding of IT security practices, such as patching, secure builds, and vulnerability remediation.
* Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., TCP/IP, VPN); exposure to F5, Single Sign-On, or Splunk is an advantage.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS and/or automation tools like Azure DevOps is a plus.
* Exposure to Linux environments or mixed OS ecosystems is an advantage but not mandatory.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: CRM Data Scientist (18 months Temporary Role)
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a CRM Data Scientist within the Loyalty & CRM team under Market Activation, you will be at the forefront of recruiting, onboarding and developing customers through our loyalty and membership program. In this global role, your contributions will have a direct and significant impact on our brand strategy.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Analyzing customer data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in CRM strategies.
* Building predictive models to forecast customer behavior and preferences.
* Developing and implement machine learning algorithms to enhance customer segmentation, targeting, and personalization efforts.
* Collaborating with the CRM team and the Value stream to design and execute A/B tests and experiments.
* Creating data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
* Continuously monitoring and evaluating the performance of CRM initiatives and recommend adjustments as needed.
* Staying up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and CRM.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 The Marketing Activation Unit within Marketing is tasked with creating a strategic plan that brings our brand direction to life across various touchpoints. Leveraging data and customer insights, we design comprehensive plans that ensure a seamless and holistic customer experience.
   

  

 Loyalty is built through every aspect of our company, from the products we create and the brand we represent to the experiences we offer. When we talk about ‘Loyalty’, we leverage two key enablers to inform our strategies and tactics: our Membership program and our CRM capabilities.
   

  

 Membership ensures identification and engagement of our member base, building a direct relationship with our customers. Through CRM activities, we increase the value of customer interactions and drive positive customer base development, generating incremental sales.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To thrive in this role, you bring strong analytical thinking, excellent communication skills, and a collaborative mindset. You’re comfortable working in fast-paced environments, translating complex data into actionable insights, and contributing meaningfully to cross-functional teams. You’re confident presenting your ideas and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders and are eager to grow your impact through hands-on work and continuous learning.
   

  

*We’re looking for candidates who have:*
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 3–5 years of experience in data analysis, machine learning, and working with CRM systems.
* Proficiency in Python and SQL, with the ability to write clean, production-ready code and participate in code reviews.
* Applied knowledge in statistics and machine learning, including model evaluation and optimization.
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and version control systems like Git.
* Strong communication skills to present insights and ML solutions to diverse audiences.
* A proactive approach to working independently while collaborating effectively within cross-functional product teams.


*And people who are:*
* Hands-on with customer segmentation, churn prediction, and recommendation systems.
* Familiar with CRM platforms such as Adobe, Salesforce, or HubSpot.
* Experienced with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP) and big data tools (e.g., Spark, Hadoop).
* Able to translate business problems into machine learning solutions and define appropriate evaluation metrics.
* Interested in contributing to Communities of Practice or mentoring junior colleagues as part of your growth journey.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

 Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

**This role is based out of Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Please note: This is a temporary position for 18 months, ending in May 2027**

title: Customer Service Specialist
description:

**Permanent, Full-time · Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





 A growing international SaaS company helping businesses manage and optimize their spend processes through innovative cloud solutions. Gives companies greater financial control, efficiency, and insight into their operations.

-

 , both spoken and written

title: (Senior) Applications & Technology Architect  – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for Information Systems Directorate (IS), Enterprise Architecture Unit (EA), at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Senior) Applications & Technology Architect** 
**\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* Internal benchmark: (Senior) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from June 2025*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you driven by the challenge of designing high-level application architectures that empower businesses to thrive?
   

  

 Do you excel at integrating complex solutions, drawing from diverse technology stacks, and leading innovation from concept to execution?
   

  

 We’re looking for a visionary architect, someone who understands that every design choice impacts the future of business operations and recognizes the power of thoughtful architecture in shaping digital transformation.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll take the lead in defining and managing our application and technology architecture. You’ll plan the structure of new systems, oversee implementation, collaborate closely with key stakeholders, and champion architectural awareness across the organization.
   

  

 Ready to make a lasting impact? Join us and help shape the future.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The role of the Enterprise Architecture Unit is to support the EIB Group to convert traditional businesses and ways of working to digital ones, using the potential of modern technologies and data. The aim is to establish a comprehensive business transformation strategy, synchronised with operational imperatives, and aligned with the overarching Digital strategy and vision. It ensures alignment in the strategic transformation journey while maintaining a consistent architecture.
   

  

 It facilitates the discussions between the Value Chains (VC) and platforms and support and monitor the Value Chains in their business processes optimisation, the delivery of solutions and activation of innovation.
   

  

 In this position, you would report directly to the Head of Unit.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Lead application & technology architecture practice. You won't just follow the trends; you'll set them. Share your vision and make a mark across the board by establishing cutting-edge principles, standards, and guidelines.
* Design Tomorrow's Solutions, Today. Dive into the heart of our operations, joining forces with our elite Solution Architects and Delivery teams. Your collaborative spirit and foresight will help sculpt the enterprise's future, ensuring our architectural efforts are not just current but pioneering.
* Navigate details across various layers, encompassing business, application, technology, data, operations, and security, the architect will exhibit exceptional proficiency in guiding the development of comprehensive, forward-looking solutions.
* Maintain the architectural body of knowledge by documenting the architectural designs in place and manage the initiatives (knowledge repository that encompass any relevant matter linked to architecture such as prioritisation, feedbacks problems or new ideas and guides architectural development)
* Turn Opportunities into innovations, with a keen eye for optimization, you'll continually enhance our application and technology landscape.
* Ensure the alignment between Application Architecture practices with markets standards and best practices, including relevant monitoring activities
* Work closely with senior leaders, transforming business needs into technological solutions, building architectural bridges that enhance our journey from aspiration to reality.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* At least 5 years of relevant professional experience as an Enterprise/ Technology/ Application Architect or similar role, with a track record of successfully delivering complex application projects
* In-depth knowledge of application architecture principles, design patterns, and integration techniques
* Expertise in multiple technology stacks, languages, and frameworks commonly used in application development
* Understanding of data architecture, including database design, data modeling, and data integration
* Experience in designing solutions that encompass application, integration, data, and business layers, fostering a unified and coherent ecosystem, preferably in Cloud environment
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open position. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
*We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*
*At Strawberry, we're not just a hotel company - we're building a universe of experiences. We're transforming the hospitality landscape through innovation and technology, and 2023 marked a major milestone with the launch of our new mother brand, Strawberry.*
 We are now looking for a talented
 **Data Engineer** 
 to join our central
 *Business Intelligence team* 
 in Technology. You'll be at the heart of everything that happens at Strawberry, working to design, build, and optimize our data warehouse and analytics ecosystem. Your work will be critical in transforming raw data into actionable insights, providing the high-quality, scalable datasets that empower business decisions, analytics, and application development across the company.
   

  

**Are you passionate about AI in data?**
 We are passionate about artificial intelligence (AI) and its potential to transform how businesses make data-driven decisions. Our team actively explores and provides the data foundation for AI-powered tools and models. If you’re excited about leveraging AI to push the boundaries of traditional BI, you’ll fit right in.
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Take ownership of the design, implementation, and maintenance of scalable and performant data models in Snowflake using dbt.
* Develop, maintain, and optimize data pipelines and ELT workflows with proper orchestration flows from sources into data warehouse solutions.
* Design and build data models in Snowflake leveraging dbt for transformations and version control.
* Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
* Write efficient Python scripts for data manipulation, automation, and integration with external APIs.
* Take a keen interest in owning the documentation for our data models and pipelines to ensure clarity and maintainability.
* Collaborate closely with data analysts, engineers, business teams, and source system owners to integrate new data and deliver powerful datasets for reporting and analytics.
* Deploy and maintain solutions within our Azure cloud environment.
* Support in the analysis of incidents, problem-solving, and bug fixes, managing support cases and hotfixes as needed.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data architecture, documentation, and development standards.


**What You'll Bring:**
* A minimum of 5-6 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, or a similar BI Developer role.
* Strong proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex and efficient queries.
* Proven experience with data modeling, back-end architecture, and data warehousing, specifically with Snowflake.
* Hands-on experience with modern data stack tools like dbt, and familiarity with orchestration tools like Airflow or Matillion.
* Solid Python scripting skills for data manipulation and automation.
* A understanding of data analysis, data visualization best practices, and storytelling techniques.
* A good grasp of data governance, version control (Git), and CI/CD principles.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
* An analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude and the ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication, active listening, and collaboration skills. You are a team player who builds trust, acts without prestige, and can establish strong relationships.
* Excellent command of English, both written and oral.
* A BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field.


**What We Offer:**
* Real Impact: Be a part of a dynamic transformation and contribute directly to our success story.
* Empowerment: Work in a flat organization with trust, autonomy, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
* Growth & Development: Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
* Fun & Community: Enjoy a vibrant work environment with plenty of social events and team-building activities.
* Fantastic Perks: Benefit from great employee discounts, including staff and friends & family rates at our hotels.
* Flexible Work: Enjoy the best of both worlds with our hybrid model, with three days of in-person collaboration at our Oslo or Stockholm HQ


 We do not offer remote positions; candidates must be located in or willing to relocate to Oslo or Stockholm.
   

  

 Ready to shape the future of hospitality with data? Apply today – we are reviewing applications continuously!

title: AI Engineer
description:
At Funnel, we’re on a mission to empower marketers to work smarter with data. Our platform helps businesses collect, organize, and analyze marketing data without the need for code — turning chaos into clarity. Thousands of marketers around the world use Funnel every day to make better, faster decisions.
   

  

 Now, we’re taking the next step: integrating AI to make data operations more intelligent, predictive, and efficient. That’s where you come in.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a new member of our Data & AI team, you’ll play a key role in shaping how we use AI to make Funnel’s teams and internal processes smarter, faster, and more scalable.
   

  

 You’ll design and implement intelligent solutions that improve operational efficiency. Everything from automating workflows and monitoring data quality to supporting internal decision-making with predictive insights. This isn’t an AI-only role - we’re looking for someone who’s passionate about solving problems, whatever the best approach may be. AI will often be your go-to tool, but not always the right one, and you’ll know when to choose something simpler or smarter.
   

  

 This is a hands-on engineering role where you’ll have a visible impact on how we run and scale our business. You’ll collaborate closely with teams across Data, Sales, Finance, and Engineering to ensure we build AI tools that make a measurable difference.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, develop, and deploy AI-driven tools and automations that optimize internal workflows and operations.
* Build, test, and maintain reliable systems that streamline repetitive tasks, improve data handling, and empower internal teams.
* Apply large language models (LLMs) and agentic approaches when they offer the most effective solution and know when traditional automation is the better fit.
* Implement evaluation, to assess the performance of these systems and measure their business impact.
* Partner with teams across the company to understand pain points and translate them into practical, AI-powered solutions.
* Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to detect anomalies, forecast workloads, and ensure data accuracy.
* Continuously explore AI technologies and evaluate them for Funnel’s internal systems, operations, and support processes.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Strong background in data or software engineering. You have solid experience building real systems, not just prototypes, and understand how to deliver production-grade solutions that are maintainable, performant, and secure.
* Ability to deliver end-to-end solutions - from prototype to deployment
* Proficient in Typescript and Python. You’re comfortable moving across the stack, from front-end interfaces to backend services.
* Familiar with cloud infrastructure and modern engineering practices. You know your way around AWS (or similar), CI/CD pipelines, version control, testing, and code review workflows.
* Practical experience integrating LLM APIs and knowing when not to; familiarity with retrieval/search (BM25/filters) and RAG when justified
* Curiosity to dive into challenges, adaptability, and drive to explore emerging AI capabilities


**Nice-to-Have**
* Experience with automation tools such as (n8n, Zapier, Make)
* Experience working with HubSpot via API and custom CRM cards via Javascript and React


**Who You Are**
 You’ll thrive here if you’re:
   

  

* Adaptable: You enjoy working in a rapidly evolving environment where priorities shift as we explore what’s possible.
* Self-driven: You like owning your projects from idea to implementation.
* Collaborative: You communicate clearly and work well across teams.
* Curious: You’re genuinely excited about AI and love experimenting to find better ways of doing things.
* Motivating: You bring energy and enthusiasm that inspires others to lean into AI.


**Why Join Funnel?**
* Massive impact: You’ll have freedom to explore, influence, and implement high-impact AI solutions from the ground up.
* Creative autonomy: Define your own path, we value experimentation and initiative.
* Collaborative culture: Work alongside a team that’s passionate, curious, and unafraid to push boundaries.
* Growth & learning: Be part of shaping how AI transforms data accessibility and operations at scale.


*If you’re looking for a pure data science or ML research role, this might not be for you. But if you love building real, working AI systems — and seeing them make a difference — you’ll enjoy this new role.*
**About Funnel**
 Take a look at our Funnel benefits!
   

  

 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting. Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with presence in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**Other Information**
 This role is based in our Stockholm office. At Funnel, we embrace an office-first approach, working on-site at least four days a week. While we offer plenty of flexibility for life’s events, summer months, and holidays, we aim to avoid fixed remote workdays.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $80M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 at Legora, you’ll lead by example—hands-on in the code while guiding a talented team of engineers. You’ll architect and deliver features that make legal professionals’ lives easier, drive technical excellence, and help shape a product used by forward-thinking law firms around the world. This is a role for someone who loves to build, mentor, and scale both people and systems.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design and implement end-to-end features across our fullstack platform
* Contribute directly to the codebase while supporting the growth of your team
* Lead architecture discussions and technical decision-making
* Ensure high standards in code quality, security, and performance
* Collaborate closely with Product and Design to ship value quickly and reliably
* Review code, give feedback, and mentor engineers at all levels
* Champion best practices in development, DevOps, and continuous improvement
* Work with Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure, and Kubernetes
* Work every day to ensure your team is healthy and efficient


 Who you are
   

  

* A seasoned fullstack or backend engineer with leadership experience
* Comfortable being hands-on while also setting technical direction
* Skilled in building scalable products and owning complex systems end-to-end
* Strong communicator who leads with empathy and clarity
* Passionate about mentoring others and helping teams grow
* Confident working across backend, frontend, and infrastructure
* Curious, pragmatic, and always looking for smarter ways to build and deliver
* But most importantly, you are someone who
+ “Gets stuff done” and understands building a $10bn company isn’t always glamorous and takes hard work and long hours
+ Proactively and independently solves the most burning problems
+ strives in a fast-paced environment where the answers aren’t always clear and processes are few


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Sr. Technical Product Manager | AI & Cloud team
description:
**About The Role**
**Your mission:** 
 Lead a cross-functional team of engineers to rebuild Apotea’s tech stack in the cloud, starting with Supply Chain, the backbone of Apotea’s operations.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Define the product vision & strategy for Apotea’s cloud transformation; starting with Supply Chain, then expanding to future domains like logistics, customer experience, and fulfillment.
* Bridge business and technology, translating operational needs into clear technical requirements and prioritizing initiatives with measurable impact.
* Hire & lead the team that is rebuilding Apotea in the cloud and setting new standards for reliability, performance, and maintainability.
* Collaborate with engineering leadership to design and implement a scalable, secure, and future-ready cloud architecture.
* Develop the product roadmap and manage tradeoffs between speed, cost, and long-term scalability.
* Ensure cross-functional alignment with operations, logistics, and data teams to deliver end-to-end business value.
* Collaborate with AI teams to ensure the new cloud foundation supports future AI-driven products and automation.
* Establish success metrics for transformation progress, focusing on operational efficiency, scalability, uptime, and developer velocity.
* Communicate progress clearly and often to leadership and stakeholders, ensuring transparency and buy-in.
* Build and inspire a high-performing team culture that values experimentation, ownership, and technical excellence.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for a
 **technical and strategic product leader** 
 who thrives at the intersection of cloud infrastructure, business operations, and product innovation.
   

  

**You’re TECHNICAL Enough To Lead Transformation**
* Understands cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), APIs, microservices, and modern data platforms.
* Familiar with DevOps, CI/CD, and software architecture principles.
* Bonus: Experience migrating legacy systems to the cloud or modernizing enterprise systems.


**You’re a PRODUCT STRATEGIST Who**
* Turns complex business and technical challenges into a clear product roadmap.
* Prioritizes outcomes that deliver real operational and business value.
* Communicates clearly across technical and non-technical teams.


**You’re a LEADER Who**
* Builds trust and momentum across diverse teams.
* Motivates engineers through clear goals, autonomy, and impact.
* Balances hands-on involvement with strategic oversight.


**You’re a SYSTEM THINKER**
* Understands how supply chain, logistics, data, and automation connect.
* Can zoom out to align architecture and business strategy, then zoom in to make practical product tradeoffs.


**BONUS Points For Experience With**
* E-commerce, logistics, or supply chain systems.
* Cloud migrations or platform rebuilds at scale.
* AI or automation technologies.
* Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus).


**What Apotea Offers You**
* A defining role in one of Sweden’s largest cloud transformation projects in e-commerce.
* The chance to rebuild Apotea’s tech foundation for the next decade of growth.
* A high-impact position reporting to the Chief AI Officer.
* A collaborative, flat organization with minimal bureaucracy.
* A culture that values experimentation, ownership, and learning.
* Opportunities for professional growth and training.
* The satisfaction of contributing to a meaningful mission; making healthcare accessible, sustainable, and efficient.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

  

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Apply
* Interview: Screening
* Interview: Technical & Product Capabilities
* Interview: Culture Fit
* Background Check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
* Offer Presented


****Location** 
 :** 
 Sveavägen 168, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

****Reports to****
**:** 
 Chief AI Officer
   

  

**Application**
 Do not hesitate to send in your application already today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.
   

  

***Join Us and Make a Difference -** 
**We hope you want to be a part of our team!***
*Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!**
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About the opportunity:**
 Are you driven by applying state-of-the-art ML engineering practices to real-world silicon challenges? Join Ericsson’s PEU Silicon as a Machine Learning Engineer and help shape the future of silicon innovation!
   

  

 This role involves developing robust, scalable ML pipelines and frameworks to deploy advanced AI methodologies into silicon product development workflows. You will engineer production-grade solutions, optimize ML performance, and integrate AI-driven capabilities directly into silicon engineering processes. As a key contributor, you will collaborate across teams, champion ML best practices, and ensure Ericsson Silicon continues to lead through advanced technology solutions.
   

  

 As a Machine Learning Engineer within PEU Silicon Operations, you will lead the design, development, and deployment of robust ML systems, data engineering infrastructure, and Generative AI solutions.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Design, implement, and maintain scalable ML pipelines for training, validation, deployment, and monitoring in silicon development.
* Develop and deploy Generative AI solutions, including LLM fine-tuning, embeddings-based search, and RAG pipelines for silicon workflows.
* Build robust data engineering solutions (ETL, integration, warehousing, data lakes, feature stores) supporting ML and Generative AI.
* Optimize ML infrastructure with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), cloud resources (AWS SageMaker, Azure ML), and CI/CD.
* Establish rigorous ML lifecycle management with version control, automated testing, validation, and performance monitoring.
* Implement and optimize data storage (SQL/NoSQL, data lakes) for silicon analytics workloads.
* Promote ethical and responsible ML engineering with transparency, reproducibility, security, and strong governance.
* Mentor peers on ML engineering, data engineering, and Generative AI best practices for PEU Silicon.
* Stay updated on emerging ML engineering, Generative AI, and data infrastructure trends, recommending innovative solutions.
* Collaborate with the Silicon Infrastructure and Tools team to align ML/data infrastructure planning, compute resources, and licensing strategies


**Skills you bring:**
* Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in computer science, Machine Learning, Electrical Engineering, or related fields (preferably with distinction).
* Minimum 3+ years of professional experience deploying ML systems, Generative AI solutions, and data engineering pipelines in production environments.
* Strong programming skills in Python, expertise with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, Spark ML).
* Hands-on expertise with Generative AI technologies (e.g., GPT-family models, embeddings, RAG pipelines).
* Demonstrated experience building and deploying machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD automation.
* Deep understanding of data engineering concepts: ETL pipelines, data warehousing, data lakes, databases (SQL/NoSQL), and data integration.
* Familiarity with structured/unstructured datasets, optimization of data pipelines, and large-scale data storage.


**Preferred skills:**
* Experience in silicon development, semiconductors, or telecommunications.
* Knowledge of agentic development frameworks and agent-based AI systems.
* Practical experience with AWS AI/ML tools like Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Bedrock, and Lambda for building, fine-tuning, deploying, and managing AI and ML models at scale.
* Experience collaborating effectively in global, matrixed organizations.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 771492

title: Sales Executive
description:
**About us** 




 We’re Talentium, a fast-growing startup revolutionizing human capital management.
 



 We’re looking for an Account Executive who can manage the entire sales funnel - from prospecting and qualifying leads to closing deals. You will work closely with the Commercial team to develop strategies for driving revenue growth and expanding Talentium’s customer base. This role is ideal for a results-driven professional who thrives on building meaningful client relationships and exceeding targets.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Manage the full sales cycle, from prospecting to closing deals.



  




* Develop and execute account strategies to achieve revenue goals.



  




* Provide customer feedback to improve product offerings, marketing strategies, and overall go-to-market execution.



  




* Build and maintain relationships with decision-makers, including talent acquisition teams and C-level executives



  




* Work closely with the Customer Success team to ensure smooth onboarding and satisfaction.



  




* Track and report sales activities and performance metrics using our CRM.



  




* Understand Talentium’s solutions inside and out to effectively communicate value to potential clients.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* 1-3 years of experience in a SaaS B2B sales role, with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding quotas.



  




* Strong understanding of B2B SaaS sales processes and methodologies.



  




* Someone who thrives on action, takes initiative, and doesn’t wait for direction to make an impact.



  




* Strong communication and relationship-building skills, with a customer-first mindset.



  




* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling messages.



  




* A data-driven approach, comfortable tracking performance metrics and optimizing strategies.



  




* Bonus: Background in HR tech or start-ups

title: IT-generalist med SQL kunskaper
description:
***Vi söker en IT-generalist med fokus på SQL som vill vara med och utveckla våra kunders IT-miljöer.***
 Hos QD får du arbeta brett inom IT-drift och infrastruktur samtidigt som du får använda din SQL-kompetens i allt från felsökning till design och förbättringar.
   

  

 Du gillar att ha överblick men är inte rädd för att gå ner på detaljnivå när det behövs. Du ser mönster i databasen, hittar orsakerna bakom problemen och gillar att bygga lösningar som fungerar över tid.
   

  

**Din roll hos oss**
 Som en del av vårt kundteam får du en central roll i att utveckla och drifta kunders IT-miljöer. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt. Ibland handlar det om att lösa konkreta utmaningar i databasmiljöer, ibland om att planera förbättringar och framtida förändringar.
   

  

 Det här är en bred IT-roll där det bland annat ingår en del fokus på SQL som en del av din vardag. Vi söker dig som har kompetens av SQL i drift- och applikationsmiljöer, med fokus på installation, administration, felsökning och stabila lösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer även att delta i större projekt, som migreringar och uppgraderingar av databaser och applikationsplattformar. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med kollegor inom drift, system och säkerhet, och med kunder som värdesätter långsiktighet och kvalitet.
   

  

**Krav**
* 3-5 års erfarenhet av SQL Server – installation, konfiguration och administration
* Felsökning och optimering av SQL-databaser
* Backup och återställning av databaser
* Grundläggande förståelse för datamodellering och säkerhet


**Meriterande**
* Azure IaaS och PaaS och AWS
* Windows Server, till exempel AD, PKI och RDS
* Nätverksförståelse, t.ex. segmentering och VPN
* Linuxmiljöer och backuplösningar


 Vi söker dig som trivs i kundnära roller, gillar att ta ansvar och som vill arbeta i ett team där kvalitet och samarbete går före snabbfixar.
   

  

**Därför trivs man på QD**
* Flexibilitet: Jobba halva veckan var du vill – hemma, på kontoret eller någon annanstans.
* Kollegorna: Här jobbar du med människor som kan sin sak och delar gärna med sig.
* Rätt storlek: Stora nog för att ge utveckling, små nog för att du ska göra skillnad.
* Teknikpeng: Du väljer utrustningen, vi står för notan.
* Utveckling: Vi gillar när du växer, testar nytt och utmanar oss.


**Kort om QD**
 QD är ett familjeägt IT-bolag som grundades 1987. Vi levererar kompletta IT- och driftslösningar till företag i hela Sverige, från våra egna datacenter. Vi är snabba, trygga och värnar om både våra kunder och våra medarbetare. Här kombineras tekniskt djup med omtanke och en arbetsmiljö där det är lätt att trivas.
   

  

 🎧 Nyfiken på hur det är att jobba här? Lyssna på vår podd på Spotify
   

  

 📍
 **Placering** 
 : Uppsala eller Stockholm
   

  

**Bakgrundskontroll**
 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller på de kandidater som är aktuella för anställning. Kontrollen görs först efter ditt samtycke
   

  

 Vi är IT-partnern med den perfekta storleken för dig! Vi bygger en långsiktig relation där vi bidrar med proaktivitet och affärsnytta för din verksamhet. Med vår leverans av IT-avdelning som tjänst gör vi alltid vårt yttersta för att leverera med hög kvalitet med ett personligt engagemang. Vi skapar förutsättningar för en bättre arbetsdag!

title: AI Solution Manager
description:
Vill du vara med att forma och utveckla hur AI används i en av Nordens mest dynamiska IT-organisationer? På itm8 söker vi nu en person som vill driva konkreta AI-initiativ i vår verksamhet samt till våra kunder – med fokus på både Microsofts AI-plattformar och andra ledande teknologier som Nvidia, Meta och open source-ramverk.
   

  

 Som AI Solution Manager hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i att identifiera, utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar som förbättrar våra interna processer. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten för att förstå behov, prioritera use cases och omsätta idéer till skalbara lösningar. Du får också en viktig roll i att höja AI-mognaden i organisationen genom workshops, utbildningar och förändringsledning.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Identifiera och prioritera interna AI-use cases (t.ex. automatisk ticket-routing, prediktivt underhåll, offertautomatisering)
* Utveckla och produktionssätta AI-lösningar i samarbete med verksamheten
* Arbeta med Microsoft Copilot, Azure AI Services, Power Platform – samt gärna även andra AI-ramverk som TensorFlow, PyTorch, HuggingFace, Nvidia AI eller Meta Llama
* Bidra till AI-governance, best practices och intern kunskapsspridning
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om trender inom AI och föreslå nya verktyg och metoder
* Stötta i externa kunddialoger där AI är en strategisk komponent
* Vara delaktig som expert i itm8 AI council


 Vi ser gärna att du har några års erfarenhet inom:
   

  

* Leda och utveckla AI/ML-projekt, självklart i någon molnmiljö
* Goda kunskaper i Python och ML-ramverk som scikit-learn, spaCy, Transformers
* AI-livscykeln i form av modellträning, inferens, drift, MLOps
* Arbetat med LLM:er, NLP, generativ AI och prompt engineering
* Kommunicera AI-koncept på ett pedagogiskt och inspirerande sätt för olika målgrupper


 Meriterande är om du även har erfarenhet inom:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Copilot, Azure OpenAI, Power Platform.
* Kunskap om AI-tillämpningar inom DevOps, ERP, CRM eller BI.
* Intresse för datahantering, dataskydd och AI-governance.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i matrisorganisationer och leda förändring.


 itm8 är en av Nordens ledande leverantörer av digital transformation och IT-tjänster. Läs mer om vår resa på www.itm8.se och följ oss på Instagram @itm8inside.
   

  

 Redo att utmana och utmanas inom AI med itm8?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Om du har frågor, skriv till oss i meddelanderutan nedan så följer vi upp med dig. Vi behandlar alla ansökningar och kontakter konfidentiellt och intervjuar löpande och rekommenderar att du söker tjänsten så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 #itm8Sverige

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM** 




 Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.
 



  





 Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.
 



  





 Together, we build the future of SAM.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As our Senior Frontend Developer at Xensam in Stockholm, you will work hands-on and become a proactive technical leader with a strong drive to solve complex problems. You’ll contribute across the entire product portfolio and support the team by providing technical guidance and stepping in wherever your expertise is needed.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will design, develop, debug, test, and enhance high-quality frontend features and integrations using JavaScript and TypeScript. You will collaborate closely with UX Designers, Product Owners, backend, and database developers to deliver great user experiences and ensure accessibility. Furthermore you will:
 


* Take ownership of the technical direction for frontend development, drive architectural decisions, and act as the go-to person for technical guidance during planning, estimation, and reviews.
* Guide the technical execution of projects, ensuring alignment with product goals, scalability requirements, and timely delivery.
* Ensure best practices across development, including CI/CD pipelines, code structure, testing strategies, and maintain high standards for code quality and performance.
* Apply modern security best practices and OWASP guidelines across all development activities.
* Promote engineering excellence by reviewing peers’ work, providing constructive feedback, enforcing best practices, and mentor junior developers.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 5+ years of experience in frontend development, including debugging, testing, and optimizing modern web applications.
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript, with deep experience in React and state management libraries such as MobX.
* Solid understanding of frontend architecture, asynchronous programming patterns, and REST API integration.
* Proficient in Git or similar version control systems, and experienced with utility-first CSS frameworks like Tailwind.
* Strong knowledge of secure coding, authentication protocols (OIDC, JWT), and error handling.
* Good understanding of relational databases and frontend-backend interaction.
* Familiar with Agile methodologies and working in Agile/Scrum teams.
* Experience mentoring, reviewing code, and upholding high standards.
* Comfortable leading technical discussions, architectural decisions, and owning frontend initiatives.
* Good communication skills and a strong proficiency in written and spoken English.
* Preferably a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.



  





**Bonus Points If You** 



* Have a full-stack background, working across both frontend and backend development.



  





**What You Get** 



* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.



  





**Our values at Xensam** 




**Rebellious** 




 We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
 



**Humane** 




 We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmony** 




 We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
 



  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
**About**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer to join our growing software team. In this role, you will design and build scalable, high-performance applications that connect embedded systems, cloud infrastructure, and user interfaces. Your work will directly support the monitoring, diagnostics, and control of our marine battery systems and at the same time support our developing efforts in cloud with both frontend and backend work.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and implement software for battery management system based on maritime standards
* Build robust APIs and backend services to interface with embedded systems and cloud platforms in a Linux environment.
* Develop intuitive and responsive front-end interfaces for internal tools and customer-facing dashboards.
* Collaborate with embedded, test, and systems engineers to ensure seamless integration across the stack.
* Implement secure, scalable, and maintainable software architectures.
* Contribute to DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
* Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and technical mentoring.


**Required Skills**
* Strong experience in fullstack development using modern frameworks, preferably Angular, Typescript and C#.
* Proficiency in designing RESTful APIs and working with IoT Solutions.
* Experience in developing hardware-near applications
* Solid understanding of software architecture and cyber security.
* Familiarity with data visualization, telemetry, and system monitoring tools.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


**Bonus Points**
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with Agile development methodologies.
* Experience in developing embedded applications using C.
* Experience with Linux systems administration.
* Experience with CI/CD and build automation with GitHub Actions
* Familiarity with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and message brokers (e.g., MQTT, Kafka).
* Knowledge of maritime compliance standards


**Why Join Echandia Marine?**
**Impact** 
 : Work on groundbreaking technology that will shape the future of sustainable marine transport.
   

  

**Growth**
