 : Develop your skills in a dual role that combines technical leadership with product strategy.
   

  

**Innovation** 
 : Join a culture that values creativity, collaboration and innovation at every level.
   

  

**Mission** 
 : Be part of a purpose-driven company working to make the marine industry cleaner and more efficient.
   

  

 The right candidate will be part of a fast growing, non-hierarchical and business focused scale-up company fighting climate change through zero-emission electrification.
   

  

 Echandia is challenging the maritime industry with safer electrification. Since its founding in 2018, Echandia has rapidly become a global leader in maritime battery systems, delivering nearly 70 systems for electrification projects worldwide. Our systems are tailored to optimize energy efficiency and reduce environmental impact, supporting the maritime industry’s transition towards sustainable operations. Based in Stockholm, we serve customers across the globe.

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Brinner du för att skapa hållbara IT-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för människor? Som Lösningsarkitekt hos Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla framtidens vård. Här får du både bidra med din kompetens och ta ansvar i en samhällsviktig miljö – där din erfarenhet verkligen gör skillnad.** 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




  





 Region Stockholm etablerar masterdataförvaltning för att utveckla hälso- och sjukvården inom regionen och för att skapa förutsättning för kommande digitalisering. Nu söker vi en Lösningsarkitekt till enheten Arkitektur, informatik och systemutveckling inom avdelningen Digitalisering och IT på Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen. Vi har ansvar för utveckling och förvaltning av vår plattform som bygger på Tibco EBX.
 



 Som Lösningsarkitekt bidrar du till att säkerställa driften, underhållet och vidareutvecklingen av plattformen för masterdatahantering och datastyrning. Du kommer bl.a. att ta fram och implementera datamodeller, arbetsflöden, regelverk för datakvalitet samt ge teknisk support och stöd till intressenter.
 



  





 Arbetsområden som ingår i rollen är:
 



  





**Arkitekturdesign** 
 - Designa teknisk arkitektur baserad på verksamhetens krav, skapa och underhålla datamodeller för masterdatahantering och datastyrning, dokumentera arkitekturdesign, integrationer och processer för plattformen.
 



  





**Systemutveckling** 
 och
 **integration** 
 - Designa, utveckla och underhålla lösningar baserade på Tibco EBX. Implementera och anpassa datamodeller i EBX enligt verksamhetskrav, utveckla och optimera arbetsflöden och regler för datastyrning (data governance), planera och implementera integration mellan plattformen och andra system.
 



  





**Datastyrning och masterdata** 
 - Säkerställa hög datakvalitet genom att implementera valideringsregler och standarder, stödja hanteringen av masterdata och metadata i organisationen, delta i arbetet med att definiera och implementera data governance-strategier.
 



 Du får möjlighet att påverka strategiska vägval, samarbeta med verksamhetsansvariga och andra arkitekter samt driva förädlingen av vår arkitektur. Genom kontinuerlig utveckling och effektiva samarbeten bidrar du till en framåtdriven digital transformation och gör konkret skillnad för patienter och vårdpersonal i hela regionen.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




  





 Som person är du lyhörd och driven med en förmåga att lyfta blicken. Vidare är du kommunikativ och skicklig på att visualisera, presentera och föra en dialog kring komplexa lösningar på ett konkret och lättillgängligt sätt. Du är dessutom utåtriktad med en god samarbetsförmåga. För att passa för rollen ser vi att du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område såsom exempelvis data/systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad genom gedigen arbetslivserfarenhet.
 



  





**Du har med dig erfarenhet av:** 




  




* IT- och lösningsarkitektur
* att leda och ge stöd i arkitektur- och designarbete, tekniska vägval samt guida initiativ och ta fram arkitekturdesign
* modellering i arkitekturverktyg som exempelvis LeanIX eller Sparx
* att dokumentera och sammanställa arkitektur- och systemdokumentation
* både förvaltning och nyutveckling i både linjen och projekt



  





 Vidare har du utmärkta kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift och vana vid agilt projektarbete samt att arbeta självständigt och målinriktat.
 



  





**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:** 




  




* REST API, FHIR, IAM, Databas och katalogtjänster
* Masterdata och masterdata management
* utveckling i Java
* BI/DW, TIBCO EBX eller Orchestra Networks
* storskaliga integrationslösningar
* stora komplexa system- och applikationslandskap
* att leda andra och haft roller som mjukvaruarkitekt, lösningsarkitekt, scrum master, tech lead och/eller lead developer



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




  





 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.
 



 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Du erbjuds även kompetensutveckling i olika former som exempelvis nätverk, mentor- och adeptsprogram samt ledarutbildning.
 



  





 Vi sitter i ljusa fina lokaler på Lindhagensgatan 98. Hit tar du dig enkelt med kollektivtrafiken.
 



**Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.** 




  





**Ansökan** 




  





 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. Sista ansökningsdag är den 13 november. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
 



 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Region Stockholm med Computer Sweden Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Linda Wallin, Rekryteringskonsult på 072 2276720, linda.wallin@csrecruitment.se
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Övrigt** 




  





 Tester kan komma att ingå i rekryteringsprocessen. Vi använder oss av Assessios tester MAP och Matrigma. MAP är en personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett problemlösningstest som båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser.
 



 Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen stödjer Region Stockholms politiska organisation för att invånarna i Stockholms län har tillgång till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt tandvård. Det innebär att förvaltningen beställer och följer upp hälso- och sjukvård och tandvård för 75 miljarder kronor årligen. Förvaltningen ansvarar också för kunskapsstyrningsorganisationen i Region Stockholm, samt en rad funktioner som är avgörande för hälso- och sjukvårdssystemet, såsom smittskydd, vårdhygien.
 **Läs mer här**

title: Senior Consulting Engineer -Stockholm
description:
**About Neo4j**
 Neo4j is the leader in Graph Database & Analytics, helping organizations uncover hidden patterns and relationships across billions of data connections deeply, easily, and quickly. Customers use Neo4j to gain a deeper understanding of their business and reveal new ways of solving their most pressing problems. Over 84% of Fortune 100 companies use Neo4j, along with a vibrant community of 250,000+ developers, data scientists, and architects across the globe.
   

  

 At Neo4j, we’re proud to build the technology that powers breakthrough solutions for our customers. These solutions have helped NASA get to Mars two years earlier, broke the Panama Papers for the ICIJ, and are helping Transport for London to cut congestion by 10% and save $750M a year. Some of our other notable customers include Intuit, Lockheed Martin, Novartis, UBS, and Walmart.
   

  

 Neo4j experienced rapid growth this year as organizations looking to deploy generative AI (GenAI) recognized graph databases as essential for improving it’s accuracy, transparency, and explainability. Growth was further fueled by enterprise demand for Neo4j’s cloud offering and partnerships with leading cloud hyperscalers and ecosystem leaders. Learn more at neo4j.com and follow us on LinkedIn.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.
   

  

 As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.
   

  

**The Role**
 Neo4j is the world’s leading graph database, and our Sales Engineering team are the people who help customers realize its value every day. Neo4j has proven to be the go-to data management solution in use cases such as Fraud Detection, Knowledge Graphs, Recommendation and personalisation, Risk management, Security, IT Management and Network Operations and many more.
   

  

 In the Neo4j Sales Engineering team, we are technologists who enjoy working directly with customers in a variety of industries, and with a wide range of technologies and architectures. We provide engineering and architecture leadership and development for the Neo4j-based solutions our customers are building.
   

  

 The responsibilities of a Sales Engineer cover a variety of tasks starting from understanding the prospective customers needs and environment, transforming the needs into an architecture including our leading-edge graph database technology and guiding all involved parties through the sales process. Demonstrating Neo4j as a technology for specific domains, whiteboarding solution architectures, and engaging at the level of technical decision makers are examples of the day-by-day work. The Sales Engineer understands business terminology, thinks in technical terms and combines both sides during the entire engagement.
   

  

 In addition to being Graph Database experts, you will need to understand and position other architectural components in a graph-based solution, such as Big Data platforms, other NoSQL stores, relational databases, caching, messaging and middleware services taking part in a Modern Data Architecture.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Working with our customers’ teams, you’ll lead and contribute to all phases of the Neo4j PreSales projects
* Be an integral part of the Neo4j sales team, helping to persuade prospective Neo4j users of the benefits and advantages of graph database technology
* Position the Neo4j technology within the customer’s environment and architecture
* Discuss solution architectures with our customers to address the technical requirements of our customers’ projects
* Design and build prototype solutions that demonstrate required functionality with Neo4j
* Help prepare solution proposals for our customer’s engineering and management teams that help address the overall project goals


**What You'll Bring**
* 5+ years working in a PreSales or Professional Services Organization
* Excellent understanding and demonstrable experience with database technologies and data modelling concepts, ideally with NoSQL stores.
* Architecture skills - ie mapping a business to technical requirements and understanding multiple components to build a solution
* Software engineering experience.
* Familiarity with at least one programming language (Java, Python, Javascript)
* Ability to engage and interact with engineers in an advisory roleComfortable and quick with learning new technologies as needed
* Passionate about solving technical problems
* Capable of educating and training small groups
* Strong understanding of the sales process
* A proactive approach to keeping the technical aspects of a sales process on track
* Industry vertical experience in one of: Financial Services, Retail, Government, Security or Pharmaceutical, Supply Chain, Manufacturing.
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills
* Ability to work independently, self-directed and remotely in a cross functional organization
* Ability and willingness to travel


**Nice To Have**
* Graph DB related experience ie Neo4j or other Property Graph or RDF platforms.
* Data Science, AI/MLData integration: ETL, Virtualisation, federation
* BI and data visualization (Tableau, Qlik, viz libraries: D3, viz.js, Linkurious...)

title: Account Manager (Enterprise)
description:
**About Proxify** 




  





 Founded in 2018 and headquartered in Stockholm, Proxify helps 2,500+ companies globally scale their tech teams with top-tier talent in Software, Data and AI. When internal demand for tech skills arises, we deliver carefully vetted, tailored developers within 48 hours removing traditional hiring delays so clients can move fast.
 



  





 Recognised by the Financial Times as the 3rd fastest-growing company in Sweden (2025), and a member of the Deloitte Fast 50 Sweden (2024), we’re trusted by startups, scale-ups and global brands like Securitas, Electrolux and Lufthansa.
 



  





**Role overview** 




  





 As an
 **Account Manager** 
 , you will support full client engagement cycles: from initial discovery and qualification, through onboarding, relationship building, and account growth. You will help clients get the most from Proxify’s developers, build trusted partnerships, and contribute to account health and retention.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 




  




* Develop and maintain strong client relationships; manage a portfolio of clients to ensure satisfaction, retention, and mutual success.
* Work with clients to understand their tech needs and team goals; help guide them through the matching process.
* Support contract negotiations, renewals and scope adjustments (with senior support), helping secure long-term client value.
* Coordinate with Proxify’s internal talent, engineering and delivery teams to align developer placements, timelines and deliverables to client expectations.
* Monitor account health, provide performance feedback, and advise clients (with internal help) on improvements or risks.
* Use your technical understanding (from direct or collaborative experience) to help match developers with client requirements, ensuring quality, fit and timely delivery.



  





**Must-have** 




  




* 1-3 years (or similar experience) handling client accounts or B2B relationships, ideally in tech, software, staffing, outsourcing or services.
* Good understanding of how technical teams operate; comfortable discussing developer skills, project delivery, and team needs.
* **Native English** 
 .
* Ability and willingness to
 **travel** 
**1-2 business trips per month** 
 as needed.
* **Commercial awareness** 
 : comfort working with scope, pricing, timelines, and resource planning.
* **Initiative and ownership** 
 : ability to manage multiple clients, respond proactively, follow through on commitments, and escalate when needed.
* **Familiarity with CRM tools** 
 , documentation, forecasting or planning (even if supported).



  





**Nice-to-have** 




  




* Experience in staffing, developer sourcing, or tech recruitment.
* Comfortable in distributed team or remote-work environments.
* Knowledge of current tech trends (cloud, AI, frameworks, remote work).
* Familiarity with enterprise contracting, procurement or legal norms.
* Wider professional network across the UK.



  





**Why you will love this opportunity** 




  





 🌐 Help tech teams close skill gaps and create job opportunities for developers worldwide.
 



 ❤️ Be part of a humble, supportive, and tech-savvy team.
 



 📈 Spearhead the growth of client partnerships in the UK and Ireland.
 



 🚀 Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth.
 



 ✈️ Work in a truly international team of 39 countries, with occasional in-person meetups.
 



  





**Why it may not be your match** 




  





 ❌ You like every day to look the same (clear routines and process), this might not be for you because we build as we go and keep things agile.
 



 ❌ You lack any exposure to or understanding of tech and its applications.
 



 ❌ You don’t have an English level (advanced or, ideally, native).
 



  





**How to apply** 




  





 Please send your CV (in English) explaining:
 



  




1. Your experience working with enterprise clients (ideally UK).
2. Your technical background working closely with developer and engineering teams.
3. Why you find Proxify’s mission attractive and what excites you about this opportunity.

title: Azure Integration Developer till Coor i Stockholm
description:
**Forma framtidens integrationslösningar i Azure – med fokus på skalbarhet, API:er och moderna arkitekturmönster.**
 Coor är en ledande leverantör av integrerade fastighetstjänster i Norden med visionen att genom ett helhjärtat engagemang kring miljö och hållbarhet skapa de hälsosammaste och mest framgångsrika arbetsplatserna. Vår verksamhet är personal- och resursintensiv och beroende av smart optimering tillsammans med en oslagbar kundupplevelse. Ny teknik med sensorer, robotar, drönare, digitala tvillingar och smart användning av data skapar nya spännande möjligheter för oss och för våra kunder.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Som Azure Integration Developer På Coor Blir Du En Nyckelperson i Ett Team Där Vi Bygger, Vidareutvecklar Och Förvaltar Integrationslösningar För Såväl Interna Behov Som För Våra Kunders Verksamheter. Vi Befinner Oss i En Spännande Fas För Att Framtidssäkra Vår Verksamhet Med Harmonisering Av Våra Leveransprocesser Och Modernisering Av Vårt IT-landskap. Hos Oss Är Integrationen Avgörande För Att Data Ska Flöda Rätt i Hela Affären, Från Kund Till Interna System. Hos Oss På Coor Och i Denna Roll Får Du
   

  

* En varm, innovativ och inkluderande arbetsplats med en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv
* Ett tätt samarbete med (bland annat!) vår integrationsarkitekt och Enterprise Architect i arbetet med arkitektur, strategi och tekniska vägval i linje med vår målarkitektur
* En bred variation av integrationstyper och system – både interna, externa och kundspecifika
* Att påverka och vidareutveckla vår integrationsplattform


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Du Är Involverad i Systemintegrationer För Både Kund Och Interna Behov, Och Tar Ansvarar För Design, Utveckling Och Test Samt Supporterar Incidenter i Produktion. Utöver Detta Samarbetar Du Nära Med Teamkollegor Och Deltar i Interna Samarbeten Inom Organisationen. Du
   

  

* Designar, bygger, testar och levererar nya integrationer med hjälp av Azure Integration Services – Logic Apps, Functions, Event Grid, Web Apps, Service Bus och API Management
* Analyserar och utreder integrationsbehov i nära dialog med interna stakeholders och kunder
* Tar ett helhetsansvar för integrationens livscykel – från lösningsförslag till produktion, inklusive incidenthantering
* Samarbetar med interna team och arkitekter för att förbättra API-hantering och dokumentation enligt OpenAPI och Swagger


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du tillhör vårt centrala integrationsteam som består av både interna utvecklare och partnerkonsulter. Teamet leds av vår Integration Manager och har tätt samarbete med andra utvecklingsteam och Enterprise Architecture. Vi har ett väletablerat arbetssätt med tydliga designmönster och tekniska principer, samtidigt som du får möjlighet att påverka våra ramverk och verktyg framåt. Vi arbetar enligt agila metoder med sprintplanering, dagliga standups och retrospektiv i teamet.
   

  

 Vi sitter i helt nya lokaler i Solna, där vi träffas på plats cirka tre dagar i veckan – i övrigt arbetar vi hybrid utifrån teamets behov.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har arbetat med systemintegration i en liknande roll, gärna i komplexa miljöer med flera system och datakällor. Du har god teknisk kompetens inom Azure tech stack – som Logic Apps, Functions, API Management och DevOps-verktyg – och trivs med att vara involverad i hela integrationskedjan: från lösningsanalys och utveckling till test, driftsättning och förvaltning. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av testautomatisering, CI/CD eller andra integrationsplattformar är det meriterande.
   

  

 Som person är du självgående, analytisk och tekniskt nyfiken. Du har lätt för att kommunicera och samarbeta, både inom teamet och med andra delar av verksamheten, och du ser det som en självklarhet att dela kunskap och bidra till ett positivt klimat omkring dig. Du är prestigelös, gillar att driva på förbättringar och har ett proaktivt förhållningssätt till både teknik och samarbete.
   

  

 Du inspirerar gärna andra med nya idéer, främjar ett DevOps-tänk och har ett öga för att minska onödig komplexitet. Vi tror också att du är en person som tycker det är kul att ha kul på jobbet – något som märks i din energi och ditt engagemang i teamet.
   

  

 Du är bekväm med både svenska och engelska som arbetsspråk, och vill gärna fortsätta utvecklas både tekniskt och i din roll framåt.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Supporttekniker till statlig myndighet
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och serviceinriktad supporttekniker till en spännande roll hos en större statlig myndighet i Stockholm. Här får du möjlighet att bidra till ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag samtidigt som du utvecklar din tekniska kompetens i en modern IT-miljö. Start – omgående Uppdragsperiod – 3 månader
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som supporttekniker blir du en del av ett team som arbetar med att ge förstklassig support till myndighetens användare. Du hanterar inkommande ärenden via myndighetens ärendehanteringssystem, felsöker och löser problem relaterade till både klient- och servermiljöer samt deltar i olika förbättringsinitiativ inom IT-stödet.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak**
* Hantera och följa upp ärenden i ärendehanteringssystemet (Nilex/NSP) \* Ge support på både hårdvara, mjukvara och nätverk \* Arbeta med Microsoft 365 och on-premise-lösningar som SharePoint och Exchange \* Administrera klienter via System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM/MECM) \* Delta i förbättringsarbete och dokumentation av rutiner


**Vem är du?**
* Har några års erfarenhet som supporttekniker eller helpdeskmedarbetare, gärna inom offentlig sektor \* Har arbetat i Nilex/NSP eller liknande ärendehanteringssystem \* Har god kunskap om Microsoft 365 och on-premise-lösningar (t.ex. SharePoint, Exchange) \* Har erfarenhet av SCCM/MECM \* Är flexibel, nyfiken och har lätt för att lära dig nya system och arbetssätt \* Trivs med att samarbeta och leverera god service


**Om verksamheten**
 Konsultrollen passar dig som på kort tid vill skaffa dig bred erfarenhet. Vi erbjuder dig chansen att arbeta på populära arbetsplatser med välkända varumärken där du kan utveckla din kompetens och bredda ditt CV. Du kommer att trivas som konsult om du söker en värld av spännande uppdrag och nya kontaktnät. Vid din sida har du din konsultchef som agerar bollplank och stöttar dig i att lyckas på dina uppdrag. Vi vill att du ska må bra och trivas med oss på Poolia. Därför erbjuder vi dig friskvårdsbidrag, rabatter på olika träningsanläggningar och ordnar regelbundet sociala aktiviteter. Självklart omfattas din anställning på Poolia av kollektivavtal, försäkringar, tjänstepension samt företagshälsovård. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Software Engineer (Platform, DevEx)
description:
**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**Platform** 




**Gelato** 
 is an
 **AI-first** 
 , cloud-native platform transforming local, on-demand production and delivery — with zero physical assets. We power:
 


* **Global production orchestration** 
 : connecting e-commerce customers to 130+ partners across 32 countries. From AI-guided plate design to smart routing and logistics, we deliver to over 5 billion people in under 72 hours—faster, greener, smarter.
* **GelatoConnect** 
 : our AI-driven print production OS that helps producers master digital printing — from inventory to shipping — by automating every step: procurement, prepress, printing, packaging, and dispatch. It’s machine-agnostic, real-time, and built for uptime, precision, and profitability.



  





**AI at the Core** 




 We are not just early adopters of AI — we’re
 **AI-native builders** 
 . Across engineering, product, and operations, we embrace AI to accelerate innovation:
 


* **AI-first development** 
 using LLMs for code generation, testing, documentation, and design exploration.
* **Autonomous AI agents** 
 driving platform resilience, observability, cost control, and internal workflow automation.
* **AI-native product features** 
 built into GelatoConnect and the core platform — improving routing, personalization, and production optimization.
* A culture of
 **continuous experimentation** 
 with RAG, agent orchestration, prompt engineering, and model fine-tuning.



  





**Responsibilities** 



* **Drive adoption of AI and agent-driven workflows** 
 to improve developer experience, automate operations, and prototype new capabilities.
* Build and evolve the Internal Developer Platform (IDP) to accelerate service delivery with reliability and scale.
* Develop internal tools, APIs, and automation that streamline developer workflows and enable self-service.
* Deliver and maintain CI/CD pipelines (Argo CD, Helm, CircleCI) and event-driven automation patterns.
* Enhance observability and feedback loops across build, deploy, and runtime stages.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Strong backend engineering skills in Go; solid knowledge of clean architecture, DDD, and event-driven systems.
* Hands-on expertise with CI/CD, GitOps workflows, and platform automation.
* Familiar with platform foundations (Terraform, Helm, Kubernetes) and DevEx tooling (IDPs, service catalogs).
* Experience with identity and access management (Keycloak or similar).
* Knowledge of observability practices in cloud-native systems.
* Excited about
 **AI-assisted development** 
 (Copilot, Claude, Cursor) and
 **agent-based automation** 
 in engineering workflows.
* Curious, collaborative, and comfortable running PoCs to validate new ideas quickly.



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Javautvecklare till SPP
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens integrationslösningar i en verksamhet som verkligen gör skillnad?* 
 Hos SPP Tech kombinerar vi innovation med hållbarhet och moderna tekniker för att skapa framtidens digitala lösningar. Teamet
 **Core & Integrations** 
 söker nu en
 **Javautvecklare** 
 – här blir du en del av ett engagerat team som ansvarar för företagets integrationslager, navet som kopplar samman interna system.
 



  





 Just nu pågår en spännande modernisering där både plattform och integrationer flyttas till Azure, och som Javautvecklare får du en central roll i det arbetet. Du kommer också att vara med och utveckla integrationer mot externa system. Här jobbar du nära arkitekter, utvecklare och andra team, med stor möjlighet att påverka och ta ansvar i en miljö där samarbete står i fokus.
 



  





**I rollen kommer du att:** 



* Utveckla, förbättra och förvalta integrationer mot SPP:s interna system
* Arbeta med parprogrammering och kodgranskning för att säkerställa hög kvalitet
* Vara delaktig i vår molnresa och jobba med moderna cloudtjänster i Azure
* Ha möjlighet att påverka val av verktyg, tekniker och arbetssätt



 Vi jobbar målstyrt och agilt med ett starkt fokus på ständiga förbättringar – både i våra lösningar och i hur vi samarbetar. Du uppmuntras till kontinuerligt lärande genom kurser, föreläsningar och interna Lunch & Learn-sessioner där vi delar kunskap och inspirerar varandra.
 



  





**Och vem är då du?** 




 Eftersom du kommer att samarbeta med både ditt eget och andra utvecklingsteam inom SPP Tech är det viktigt att du är kommunikativ både på svenska och engelska. Du trivs med att dela kunskap, lösa problem tillsammans och bidra till en öppen och prestigelös teamkultur.
 



  





**Utöver detta ser vi gärna att du har:** 




 ✔ Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling
 



 ✔ Stark bakgrund inom Javautveckling
 



 ✔ Vana att arbeta i moderna cloudmiljöer och med containerbaserad infrastruktur
 



 ✔ Eftergymnasial utbildning inom systemutveckling eller liknande område
 



  





**Vår teknikstack är primärt:** 



* Java (Maven/Gradle), Spring Boot och Apache Camel
* GitHub Actions och CI/CD-pipelines
* SQL
* Testdriven utveckling (TDD)
* Azure som molnplattform, inklusive Azure Service Bus
* Inom en snar framtid: Docker och Kubernetes



  





**Att vara anställd på SPP** 




 Vi tror på balans, trygghet och långsiktighet – både i arbetslivet och privat. Därför erbjuder vi ett generöst förmånspaket som främjar hälsa, flexibilitet och framtid.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka in din ansökan genom länken
 **här.** 
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Ants, så sök tjänsten via deras jobbportal.
 



 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta gärna rekryteringsansvarig Sofia Odeen på sofia.odeen@ants.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande – så vänta inte med din ansökan!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Vi är en del av norska Storebrand, tillsammans är vi en av Nordens ledande koncerner för sparande och försäkringslösningar. Vi utmärker oss bland annat genom vårt fokus på hållbarhet och ansvarsfulla investeringar.
 



  





*Med kandidatens samtycke görs en bakgrundskontroll under anställningsprocessens slutskede som innebär kontroll av personalia, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor. Även CV och annan ansökningsdokumentation kan komma att verifieras.*

title: Sr. Database Specialist SA, AGS-EMEA-Europe North
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about helping customers build database and cloud solutions? Come join us !
   

  

 At Amazon, we've been investing deeply in building the right solutions that allow you to derive the most value from your database infrastructure. AWS is looking for a solutions architect for our Database team, who will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) helping customers to design complex solutions. As part of the team, you will work closely with Europe North customers across industry verticals (Financial Services, Media and Entertainment, Manufacturing, Technology, Health Care and Life Sciences, Retail, etc.) to enable large-scale use cases and drive the adoption of advanced AWS services. You will interact with other Solution Architects in the field, providing guidance on their customer engagements, and you will develop white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers to fully leverage AWS.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As a key member of the AWS Europe North Specialist Solutions Architecture team your work will include:
   

  

* Working closely with our product and field teams and 3rd party model providers, you will help enable new capabilities for our customers to develop and deploy data workloads on AWS infrastructure
* Design best in class database infrastructure solutions for all stages of customer and product lifecycles.
* You will have the technical depth and business experience to deploy database and data strategies.
* Partner with SAs, Sales, Business Development and Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment.
* You will also work closely with account teams, research scientists, and product teams to drive model implementations and new solutions.
* Thought Leadership - Evangelize and share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Summit, AWS re: Invent, etc.
* Act as a technical liaison between customers and the AWS teams to provide customer driven product improvement feedback.
* Develop and support an AWS internal community of related subject matter experts.


 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Knowledge of AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals
* Knowledge of cloud architecture
* Deep knowledge and experience on at least one commercial relational database (Oracle, SQL Server, IBM2), or open source database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB)
* Knowledge of AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals Knowledge of cloud architecture Deep knowledge and experience on at least one commercial relational database (Oracle, SQL Server, IBM2), or open source database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB)


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Cloud Technology Certifications (such as Solutions Architecture, Cloud Security Professional or Cloud DevOps Engineering)
* Knowledge of non-relational databases such as mongodb, couchdb, redis


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3115514

title: Erfaren Salesforceutvecklare till Handelsbanken
description:
Vill du vara med och vidareutveckla vår Salesforceplattform? Vi söker en erfaren Salesforceutvecklare som vill vara med på resan när vi tar plattformen till nästa nivå.
   

  

**Ditt team**
 Du blir en del av ett team som består av Salesforce utvecklare, Business Analyst, Testare, Product Owner och Team Coach. Tillsammans ansvarar teamet för att leverera funktionalitet som stödjer Handelsbankens CRM-lösning baserad på Salesforce. Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och du kommer samarbeta nära andra utvecklare och arkitekter, inom och utanför vårt område. Vi har roligt på jobbet och vårt team präglas av hög kompetens och bred erfarenhet inom både teknik och affärsverksamhet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Salesforce utvecklare kommer du att vara en del av ett högpresterande team där innovation och problemlösning står i fokus. Du kommer tillsammans med teamet ta fram och utveckla tekniska lösningar enligt Salesforce best practise. Vi drivs av att testa nya saker och se hur vi kan ta in dessa i våra leveranser. Teamet kommer översätta strategiska verksamhetsmål till IT-lösningar, säkerställa riskhantering och att lösningar uppfyller regelverksefterlevnad, samt säkerställa kvalitet och effektivitet på leveranser.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är utvecklare och har gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling och implementation av Salesforce. Du kan arbeta självständigt och har god förståelse och erfarenhet av olika Salesforce produkter. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla användarorienterade, effektiva, och skalbara Salesforce applikationer enligt bästa praxis i den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du tidigare arbetat med Marketing Cloud eller Data Cloud då vi nu håller på att titta på nästa del i resan,
 *Market Automation och AI.* 
 Eftersom vi samarbetar med hela koncernen krävs goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi söker även dig som har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att implementera Lightning Components, Flows, Apex Controllers, Batch Apex, Schedulers och Apex Triggers
* kunskap om att integrera Salesforce med externa applikationer med hjälp av tredjepartsverktyg via SOAP och REST API-integration
* certifieringar inom Salesforce tex Salesforce Administrator, Plattform Developer 1, Sales cloud och Service cloud
* varit involverad i större implementeringar av Salesforce i en stor organisation


 Som person strävar du efter att arbeta tillsammans med ditt team så att ni gemensamt kan komma fram till de bästa lösningarna och nå uppsatta mål. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och hjälper till där det behövs. Det kommer naturligt att tänka i nya banor för att komma till skalbara lösningar. Du håller dig uppdaterad kring det senaste inom ditt område och omvärldsbevakar för att söka efter bästa möjliga lösningar.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Som ett steg i Handelsbankens rekryteringsprocess krävs en godkänd bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat, utförd av en extern part, innan anställning kan ske.*
**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Fredrik Rutberg, fredrik.rutberg@handelsbanken.se & Ann-Chistine Stålfors, ann-christine.stalfors@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Talent Acquisition Partner:** 
 Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:** 
 Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** 
 Paul Gutesten, paul.gutesten@handelsbanken.se

title: Provcellsingenjör/ Test Bed Engineer
description:
**Provcellsingenjör/ Test Bed Engineer**
========================================

  

**Är du en lagspelare med passion för teknik, fordon och framtidens drivlinor? Då kan du vara den vi söker!**



Vi söker dig som trivs med varierande arbetsuppgifter – både praktiska och teoretiska – och som vill vara en del av utvecklingen av morgondagens teknik. Just nu söker vi provcellsingenjörer till våra anläggningar i Södertälje och Haninge.  

Vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi kontaktar och intervjuar kandidater allt eftersom ansökningarna kommer in – vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan!

  


**DINA ANSVARSOMRÅDEN:**

  


I rollen som provcellsingenjör kommer du att arbeta nära både teknik och kund. Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter inkluderar:


* Förberedelse, installation och övervakning av provobjekt
* Kalibrering, service och underhåll av provobjekt och provcell
* Kvalitetssäkring och analys av provdata
* Konfiguration av mätsystem – både hårdvara och mjukvara
* Systematisk felsökning och dokumentation
* Praktiskt arbete med provobjekt och testutrustning
* Godshantering och logistik
* Identifiering och rapportering av avvikelser
* Daglig kontakt och samarbete med kund

  





**DIN PROFIL:**

  


För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:


* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team
* En stark vilja att utvecklas och lära dig nytt
* Erfarenhet av praktiskt mekaniskt arbete med fordon, maskiner eller liknande
* Förståelse för vikten av att följa processer och rutiner, men också förmåga att lösa problem på egen hand
* Ett kvalitetsmedvetet arbetssätt och intresse för förbättringsarbete
* God teknisk förståelse för drivlinor
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* Möjlighet att arbeta enligt skiftschema (2-, 3- eller 4-skift)
* B-körkort (krav)

  

  

Meriterande:


* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant tekniskt område
* Erfarenhet av provning eller utveckling i kontrollerad miljö

  





**Intresserad?**  

Skicka genast in din online ansökan till AVL!


**About AVL**

We provide concepts, solutions and methodologies in fields like vehicle development and integration, e-mobility, automated and connected mobility (ADAS/AD), and software for a greener, safer, better world of mobility.

title: Technical Information Specialist / QA Test Planner
description:
For our client we are looking for a skilled communicator, who values solid technical processes and enjoys working closely with Engineers to deliver a developer experience that meets the highest quality standards. As a Technical Information Specialist in combination with the role of a QA Engineer within the team, you will play a key role in setting new standards for an exceptional developer experience. You will work with a team of talented Developers, Designers, Business Analysts, Product Managers and collaborate with other stakeholders to deliver content and clarity for our Developer Portals. Your dedication to quality standards and processes complements your passion for creating clear end-user documentation, ensuring that our Developer Portals are well-structured, bug-free, and easy to maintain.
  
Work description
  
* Support teams in creating detailed and engaging tutorials that guide end users through every step of their developer journey.
* Review and publish API documentation and other content for clarity, grammar, and consistency, ensuring all documentation adheres to Volvo’s standards and provides a seamless, uniform experience.
* Translate complex technical concepts into an accessible language for diverse audiences, including end users, developers, and stakeholders.
* Plan and conduct thorough usability testing to gather valuable feedback and implement data-driven improvements to enhance the overall user experience.
* Participate in the planning stages of development to help secure and maintain high quality testing standards throughout the project lifecycle.
* Collaborate closely with Product Development Teams, Engineers, Digital Product Owners, and other stakeholders to drive our journey toward developer self-service, ensuring consistent alignment with business objectives and strategic goals.


**Skills and Experiences required:**  

* A university degree in a relevant field and at least 5- 10 years of combined experience in developing user-friendly end-user documentation and conducting quality assurance for software or website testing.
* A good understanding of information architecture principles as well as familiarity with content management systems (CMS).
* Experience with Jira, Confluence, and agile methodologies.
* Expert in Technical writing/Technical Documentation of SW (Please note that it has to be within SW NOT HW).
* You have excellent communication and networking skills
* Pro-active and a problem solver
* Attentive to details and with strong focus on quality
* You have worked as a QA and/or Test Lead with a great ability to create test plans and work in a structured way.
* Used to working in a global environment
* You are located in Gothenburg and can start more or less right away.


Please do not hesitate to apply as soon as possible as we interview on rolling basis.

title: Electrical Design Engineer till Väderstad i Linköping!
company: Tech Talents Consulting i Sverige AB
description:
Om uppdraget
  
Väderstad är en ledande aktör inom jordbruksindustrin, och är på en resa mot en mer avancerad och automatiserad framtid. Med en ständigt ökande befolkning och mindre och mindre jordbruksmark blir vikten av högteknologiska, robusta och kvalitativa maskiner som gör det enkelt för bönder att åstadkomma enastående resultat en förutsättning för framgång. Här ligger Väderstad med sina jordbearbetnings- och såmaskiner i branschens framkant vilket ställer höga krav på kontinuerlig innovation och utveckling.
  
Drills Software and Electronics är en utvecklingsavdelning som arbetar med mjukvara, elsystem och elektronik för deras precisionssåmaskiner. Inom gruppen ansvarar de för elektronisk hårdvara som egna styrsystem, sensorer, motorer och kablage. De befinner sig i fronten när det gäller styrsystem för jordbruksmaskiner, det betyder att nya idéer är nödvändiga och innovation tillåts att ta plats.
  
Dina ansvarsområden
  
Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med Väderstads elsystem med fokus på nyutveckling och underhåll. Som Electrical Design Engineer kommer du att vara med i hela kedjan från produktidé till test på fysisk maskin. Väderstad har ett nära samarbete med externa leverantörer och deras andra avdelningar internt inom till exempel hydraulik och mekanik. Hos Väderstad finns goda möjligheter att växa och utvecklas. Gruppen består idag av ett team på 4st medarbetare. De har en väldigt god sammanhållning i gruppen och samarbetsförmåga är viktigt för dem.
  
Kvalifikationer
  
Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med elsystem och elektronik och brinner för att säkerställa högsta kvalitet i varje steg. Du gillar robusta lösningar och snygga installationer och du vill gärna åka ut till en maskin för att se och testa dina lösningar. Du är initiativtagande och har ett driv att tillsammans med teamet att leverera kvalité i dina arbetsuppgifter och nå uppsatta mål. Har du dessutom en teknisk utbildning på högskole- eller universitetsnivå är du en ännu bättre matchning.
  
Väderstad värdesätter personlighet högt och söker dig som, utöver rätt kompetens, har en positiv inställning och en förmåga att bidra till deras team med engagemang och samarbetsvilja. Idag är det ett gott team med härlig stämning och ser att driv och initiativtagande är viktiga egenskaper hos dig för att trivas. För att sedan kunna göra jobbet med kvalité är noggrannhet, analytisk förmåga och problemlösning till din nytta. Att arbeta självständigt tillsammans med andra för att nå bra resultat är inte en utmaning för dig!
  
  

**Vi tror att du har erfarenhet inom:**  

* 3D CAD. Väderstad arbetar i Creo/Windchill.
* Installation av kablage och elektronik

title: Product Image Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
Product Image Engineer, Lund
Job Description*Do you want to be part of a team developing new products and features using cutting edge technologies?* *We want you to join us on our journey to innovate for a smarter, safer world at our HQ in Lund!*  

Who is your future team?
Working together in a team, you will be a part of how our new multi-channel cameras come to life. We are responsible for the image quality in products aiming for a smarter, safer world. You will be collaborating with co-workers from different disciplines, such as mechanical design, electronics, software, production testing and more.
As an Image Engineer at Axis, you will play an essential part in the development of our new products. You will work together in teams of dedicated engineers, to solve image related challenges in our network video products. We have very close co-operation, and a friendly team-spirit at Axis, ensuring an agile development of market-leading products. We strongly believe in knowledge sharing and insights. It’s a great part of our culture!
What will you work with?
As an Image Engineer at Axis you will work in cross functional teams to develop new cameras from a concept phase to a complete product. Your responsibility will be to optimize the image in regards to optics, image sensors and signal processing. It will also require writing production tests, making sure that our image quality is state-of-the-art. The position of Image Engineer is very broad and you will cooperate with many different roles and organizations at Axis.
Your main tasks will be:* Optimizing image quality in the projects that develop new cameras. This is done using exposure and focus algorithms, noise filtering, white balance- and color-calibration.
* Participating and contributing to the choice of optics and image sensors. This is done in cooperation with the mechanics and electronics teams as well as external partners.
* Testing cameras, optics and image sensors during development in the lab, but also in real environments both indoor and outdoor.
* Developing prototypes, in cooperation with hardware and mechanics engineers, for the purpose of testing and optimizing the image.
* Assisting in development of the camera firmware.
* Developing and improving our production tests and calibration of our image system.


Who are we looking for?
You are curious and passionate about technology, love challenges and enjoy solving them in a team-focused atmosphere. We also believe that you have a personal drive and are inspired by working in an environment of openness, creativity, trust, commitment, playfulness, and encouragement. As Axis values teamwork it is important that you contribute with good spirit and welcome the agile working methodologies used in our projects.
We'd love to hear if you have any combination of these skills:* An engineering master’s degree in physics, nano, mathematics engineering, computer science, electrical engineering or equivalent.
* Knowledge in optics, image sensors, IR filters and IR diodes.
* Experience of C and/or C++.
* Experience of programming in Python.
* Development of software in a Linux environment.
* Knowledge of image processing algorithms.
* Advanced mathematics and statistics.


What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis  

Ready to Act?  

Apply today, we evaluate applications continuously. We are looking forward to meeting you!
If you have any questions don´t hesitate to contact recruiting manager Adam Miller at +46 46 272 1800.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world together
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-11-29*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Mechatronics Design Engineer
description:
Location: Danderyd, Stockholm, Sweden

Department: Vacuum Automation Division

Type: Permanent

**About Piab Group:**

At Piab Group we improve our customers' productivity, sustainability, and safety through evolving industrial automation and have done so since 1951. We believe in an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. With annual sales of ~3 billion SEK and more than 1400 employees, Piab is a global organization, serving customers in more than 100 countries from a vast network of subsidiaries and channel partners. Since 2018, Piab Group has been owned by Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB

**You can expect the following from us:**

- Innovative Culture: Work in an environment that fosters creativity and bold ideas.

- Advanced R&D Facilities: Access cutting-edge resources, including a robotics lab, 3D printing (SLS, SLA, FDM), a fully equipped machine workshop, injection moulding, and environmental testing equipment.

- Global Impact: Join a world leader in vacuum automation solutions with 25+ sales offices and 900+ partners worldwide.

- Sustainability Focus: Help shape a future where automation improves safety, efficiency, and minimizes waste.

- Career Growth: Unlock opportunities for continuous learning and development.

- Diverse & Inclusive Environment: Join a workplace that values diversity, collaboration, and innovation.

- Stable & Visionary Employer: Partner with a company backed by strong, long-term financial support.

At Piab, we envision an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. Be part of our journey to make this vision a reality!

**Your Role:**

As a Mechatronics Design Engineer, you will play a key part in driving research and development for the next generation of vacuum automation products. You will work both creatively and analytically, from concept and prototyping to

testing and final product – always with a focus on technical excellence and future-proof solutions.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

- Technical Research & Development: Innovate, develop, and refine mechanics for advanced vacuum automation products.

- Prototyping & Testing: Build prototypes, plan and execute tests, and develop necessary test equipment.

- Cross-Functional Projects: Work in multidisciplinary teams and contribute your technical expertise to product development projects.

- Technical Documentation: Ensure and approve design documentation in TeamCenter PLM.

- Supplier Collaboration: Work closely with suppliers to optimize technical solutions for quality and scalability.

- Technology Watch: Stay updated on the latest advancements in production methods, materials, and mechanical design.

- Continuous Improvement: Contribute to more efficient workflows, improved work environment, and higher productivity.

- Lifecycle Management: Support products throughout their lifecycle, from development to production and operation.

- Internal Technical Support: Provide technical guidance to other departments and ensure smooth collaboration.

- Compliance & Quality: Ensure products meet all legal, regulatory, and quality requirements.

**PREFERRED COMPETENCIES:**

- Experience with FEM, Moldflow, and TeamCenter PLM.

- Swedish language skills (preferred but not required).

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION:

- Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering, or similar, with 1–3 years of relevant work experience.

- Technical Expertise: Proficiency in 3D CAD software (such as SolidWorks or similar), with hands-on experience in advanced product design (electronics, pneumatic solutions, or high-end products).

- Analytical & Solution-Oriented: Strong analytical skills, curiosity, and a proactive approach to tackling technical challenges.

- Passion for Technology: Genuine interest in technology, research, and product development, with a drive to innovate and learn.

- Team Player: Collaborative and humble mindset, with a strong sense of urgency and the ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams.

- Digital Proficiency: Skilled in Microsoft Office and related digital tools.

- Outstanding Communication: Fluent in English (written and verbal), with the ability to clearly convey complex ideas.

This is what our employees say about us:

"At Piab, I have the chance to leave my own footprint. The low hierarchy means my ideas are heard and valued. #LoveWhereIWork"

How to Apply:

If you are passionate about innovation and want to make a difference in the world of automation, we would love to hear from you! Use the following link to upload your CV.

Please be advised that a valid work permit for the country we offer the open vacancy in is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit cannot be considered.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

Piab USA, Inc. Office
65 Sharp Street
Hingham, MA 02043

title: Beamline Engineer TomoWISE
description:
Lund University was founded in 1666 and is repeatedly ranked among the world’s top universities. The University has around 47 000 students and more than 8 800 staff based in Lund, Helsingborg and Malmö. We are united in our efforts to understand, explain and improve our world and the human condition. Lund University welcomes applicants with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We regard gender equality and diversity as a strength and an asset.

**Your team**  

MAX IV has recently secured funding to build TomoWISE – a new tomography beamline dedicated to advancing materials science for sustainability. To bring this vision to life, we are forming a specialized team responsible for turning the beamline design into a fully operational facility.


As a member of this team, you will collaborate closely with experts across both our Technical and Science divisions to plan, install, and commission cutting-edge infrastructure and equipment. The project will be led by the TomoWISE Beamline Lead Scientist, and the team will be part of the Beamline Office Group within our Science Division.  

  

**Would you like to work at one of the brightest lightsources in the world?**  

  

**MAX IV is looking for** an experienced engineer to join the TomoWISE beamline project. In this role, you will take the lead in planning, coordinating, and following up on the installation of infrastructure and components during the construction phase. You will also be responsible for managing and maintaining beamline documentation throughout the build.


You will play a key role in the design and development of instrumentation, whether developed in-house or in collaboration with external partners. As the project progresses, you will be actively involved in equipment testing, commissioning activities, and documentation during the commissioning phase.


Once the beamline becomes operational, your responsibilities will extend to maintaining, further developing, and optimizing the instrumentation and sample environments, ensuring the beamline operates at its full potential.

 **Your main work tasks will be**

* Plan and coordinate the installation of infrastructure and instrumentation in collaboration with the TomoWISE Project Manager
* Work on the Procurement documentation and review the suppliers’ proposals
* Prepare the necessary beamline documentation for the construction phase, in accordance with the MAX IV standards
* Lead the design of beamline-specific instrumentation in close collaboration with in-house experts and external partners
* Actively participate in the testing and commissioning of the beamline and its endstations.

**To be successful in this role you need to have the following qualifications**

* Deep knowledge of complex motion systems is essential
* Knowledge of 3D CAD software, and the ability to prepare 2D drawings for production
* Experience with designing or modifying complex precision mechanics systems
* Strong motivation for novel technical development
* Solid electronics background is welcome

**Below are seen as merits**

* Knowledge of Solidworks
* Basic knowledge of programming languages such as Python
* Knowledge of complex vacuum systems
* Hands-on experience working at synchrotron facilities or other large-scale experimental research infrastructures.

**As a person you are** organized, take initiative, and enjoy the combination of designing instrumentation and being 'hands-on'.

 **What we offer**  

When you join our MAX IV team, you step into a world of front edge science. We make the invisible visible by supporting scientist from all over the world, generating scientific results for the benefit of society. We offer you a multicultural work environment with great opportunities for personal development with respect for a healthy work-life balance.


Would you like to work in a challenging and supporting environment? Then join us and take the opportunity to make a real difference!  

  

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, and candidates may be invited for interviews before the application deadline.

 **For further information, please visit:**  

https://www.lunduniversity.lu.se/about-lund-university/work-lund-university
  

www.sweden.se
  

https://www.maxiv.lu.se/about-us/careers/compensation-benefits/


Probationary period may apply.

  

MAX IV is a Swedish national large-scale research infrastructure hosted by Lund University. It provides scientists from Sweden and abroad, with intense x-rays and state-of-the-art instrumentation for research in areas such as engineering, physics, structural biology, chemistry and nanotechnology. Its 16 beamlines receive up to 2 000 scientists annually, conducting ground-breaking experiments in materials and life sciences using the brilliant X-rays.


We kindly decline all sales and marketing contacts.

title: I&V Engineer
description:
**We collaborate with Academic Work for this recruitment. Please send in your application through this link:** **Integration & Verification Engineer to Mycronic! | Academic Work**

Mycronic is a global high-tech company whose innovative solutions has been advancing electronics technology for over 50 years. Today, we continue to grow and serve customers across an expanding variety of industries. What we do impacts the future of technology, and in turn, the way we live our lives tomorrow. We’re looking for people to join our talented, motivated, and friendly team at the cutting edge. In an open, collaborative, and flexible environment, you’ll work alongside leading industry experts and take on challenging projects that bring tomorrow’s electronics to life. Take the chance to join our Integration & Verification team and be an important part in the work to ensure the quality of our world leading products!  



**About the role**

Mycronic has experienced strong growth in recent years, both organically and through acquisitions. With headquarters in Sweden, Mycronic is a global organization with subsidiaries, agents, and distributors in over 50 countries. Mycronic is divided into four divisions, and in this role, you will belong to PCB Assembly Solutions (PA). PA is a leading provider of equipment and solutions for surface mount technology (SMT) to electronics manufacturers who require rapid production adjustments while maintaining high efficiency. PA delivers systems for circuit board assembly, including both complete line solutions and individual systems for specific process steps, as well as advanced software for assembly process management and connected factories.


The team you will be joining currently consists of three colleagues working with test, integration and verification. Due to an upcoming retirement, we are now looking for a replacement who will focus on system verification, laboratory maintenance, and, in the long term, beta test support at our customers’ sites. In addition to your immediate team, you will also collaborate with other teams within I&V as well as software and hardware development teams in Sweden, the Czech Republic, and Japan.


**You are offered:**

* The opportunity to work in a multicultural company with knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful colleagues.
* To work in an exciting company in a growth phase, where you can make a real impact in a fun and dynamic environment. Mycronic is a global company, yet small enough for you to truly make a difference.
The opportunity to work with world-leading products. Learn more about the products you will work with here .  
* 

**Work tasks**

You will work in a broad role with planning, executing and reporting test and verification, primarily on Mycronic Pick & Place machines. You will participate in planning meetings with the team, as well as collaborating closely with hardware and software designers and architects, defining what needs to be tested, discussing requirements, identifying new functions, and determining which test cases should be created — all with the goal of ensuring that the machine works correctly before release to the customer.


Over time, you will also participate in the beta test phase, planning and coordinating tests together with customers and the development teams. You will be on-site with customers during the installation of new software or hardware to ensure that everything functions as intended. The role also involves communicating clearly with customers, explaining new features and their usage, and collecting and following up on feedback from the test period.


**Furthermore, you will:**

* Execute integration, verification, and test cases on various machines and machine generations according to the test leader’s plans.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to plan tests for new functions — understand requirements, identify what needs to be tested, and why.
* Perform practical testing on both software and hardware, and report results in Jira/Confluence.
* Contribute to the development of automated tests, for example through Python scripts.
Ensure that equipment and machines are properly maintained and in good working condition.  
* 

**We are looking for**

This is a role for you who are meticulous and with a strong attention to detail - qualities that will allow you to grow into new responsibilities and contribute to our development processes. You are curious and driven, eager to ask questions, explore, and continuously learn and spread your knowledge in the organization as well with customers.


**Furthermore, you have…**

* At least a bachelor degree within computer science, electronics, mechatronics or similar
* At least a few years of work experience within test and verification of products containing both soft- and hardware
* Good understanding of both Windows and Linux operating systems, including file management, basic troubleshooting, and running scripts or applications in these environments
* Strong knowledge in English, written and spoken alike

**It is considered advantageous if you have...**

* Knowledge in Swedish
* Experience from customer-facing roles in a similar contexts
Experience in database management  
* 

**Other Information**

Start date: By agreement
  

Employment type: Permanent
  

Scope: Full-time
  

Location: Kista
  

Contact Information: Senior Recruitment Consultant Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se, and Recruitment Coordinator Minna Loosaar, minna.loosaar@academicwork.se.
  

The recruitment process is handled by Academic Work, and Mycronic requests that all questions regarding the process goes to Academic Work.  

  



**Our recruitment process**

**We collaborate with Academic Work for this recruitment. Please send in your application through this link:** **Integration & Verification Engineer to Mycronic! | Academic Work**

* Phone interview with Academic Work
* Problem-solving and personality test
* In-depth interview with Academic Work
* Interviews with Mycronic
* Reference check + decision
* Mycronic AB (publ)

Read more about Mycronic on our website: https://www.mycronic.com/  



**We collaborate with Academic Work for this recruitment. Please send in your application through this link:** **Integration & Verification Engineer to Mycronic! | Academic Work**

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.

 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.

 Beneficial skills

We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games.  Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
*Full-time*
 We’re on the lookout for an ambitious fullstack engineer to join our engineering team at our office in Stockholm.
   

  

**About Atlar**
 Money is the lifeblood of business and the tools for managing it are overdue for an upgrade. We're changing the way businesses manage money by providing a radical new way. And this change is happening fast – two years after launch, Atlar is used by companies such as Acne Studios, GetYourGuide, Forto, and HomeToGo to manage over €1bn in annualized payments volume.
   

  

 Atlar is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and backed by Index Ventures, investors in category defining companies such as Adyen, Revolut, Figma, and more.
   

  

 Joining us, you will
   

  

* Build and optimize key customer features in our dashboard.
* Make sure customers can rely on the data they are provided through the dashboard while making performance and scalability optimizations.
* Work with modern technologies such as TypeScript/React and a system free from legacy.
* Develop and maintain the infrastructure of the application, working with GitHub Actions and AWS technologies such as S3, CloudFront, and AWS CDK
* Join a small, highly skilled, engineering team and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in fintech—learning from their expertise and contributing your own.
* See your ideas go from concept to implementation, impacting customers within your first few days.


 Who you area
   

  

* Driven. You're not just here to write code - you're here to win and make a significant impact.
* Passionate. You're insatiably curious and forever asking "why?" Your keen interest in payments and fintech drives your desire to learn more each day.
* Autonomous. You take ownership of projects and see them through to completion. You're self-directed, proactive, and able to handle uncertainties.
* Technical. You understand that the devil is in the details. Your appreciation for the technical aspects of our field ensures you aim for excellence and precision.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree or higher in an Engineering or Computer Science related field.
* At least 1 years of professional software development experience.
* Fluency in English.
