title: Java Developer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att forma din karriär precis som du önskar. Här blir du en del av en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap av engagerade kollegor världen över. Tillsammans utmanar vi gränserna för vad som är möjligt. Följ med oss och bidra till att hjälpa världens ledande organisationer att maximera teknikens potential och skapa en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Hos oss på Capgemini får du inte bara jobba med Java – du får forma framtiden. Vi ligger i framkant när det gäller Generative AI, Data Engineering och skalbara molnplattformar. Våra projekt ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas inom cutting-edge teknologier som Java, Spring, AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, OpenShift, Kafka, GraphQL, React, Angular och Android. På vårt Stockholmskontor trivs vi i rymliga, ljusa lokaler med daglig frukost, nybryggt kaffe och en fantastisk utsikt över kanalen vid Barnhusbron.
   

  

*I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:*
 Arbeta som Java Developer i spännande konsultuppdrag tillsammans med ett supporterande team omkring dig.
   

  

 Främja samarbete, proaktiv problemlösning och högkvalitativ leverans av Java-baserad programvara.
   

  

 Utnyttja din erfarenhet av Java, Spring och relaterade teknologier för att designa och utveckla robusta, skalbara och effektiva backend-system.
   

  

 Förmåga att handleda andra utvecklare, genomföra kodgranskningar och driva bästa praxis.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Minst 4 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
   

  

 Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
   

  

 Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som AWS, GCP eller Azure är meriterande
   

  

 Kunskap inom Data Pipeline, Data Visualization eller Generative AI är ett stort plus
   

  

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
 Oavsett om du vill axla rollen som tech lead, fördjupa dig i arkitektur eller bli specialist inom en viss teknologi, får du här alla verktyg för att lyckas. Vi arbetar med kunder i olika branscher, vilket betyder att du ständigt står inför stimulerande tekniska utmaningar. Hos oss är kunskap och utveckling i fokus – vi erbjuder certifieringar, utbildningar och mentorskap för att du alltid ska ligga steget före.
   

  

 En arbetsmiljö med kollegor som stöttar och inspirerar varandra, och chefer som har ditt bästa i fokus, samt ett brett utbud av karriärmöjligheter och tillgång till Capgeminis stora utbildningskatalog, särskilt inom den senaste teknologin för generativ AI och data engineering. En företagskultur där mångfald och inkludering värdesätts högt, samt möjligheter till internationella karriärer och ett fantastiskt nätverk av 340,000 kollegor globalt.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Redo att starta ett nytt kapitel i karriären? Vi kan knappt vänta på att få höra från dig! Ansök redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Vi lovar att göra din resa mot jobbet så smidig och givande som möjligt. Är det dig vi letar efter? Vi ser fram emot att ses!
   

  

 Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller kan genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
At CtrlPrint, our vision is to simplify corporate reporting worldwide. With offices in Helsinki, Sydney, Stockholm, and London, we are a truly international company, trusted by 1,000+ clients to secure their most critical documents.
   

  

 As a top-performing SaaS company (recognized as a Gazelle company in 2023 and 2024), CtrlPrint offers a dynamic, high-energy workplace where you can make a real impact. If you thrive in an environment that combines the best of a scalable business and a startup mindset, this is the place for you.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a QA Automation Engineer at CtrlPrint, you will be a key contributor to building our test automation capabilities while maintaining product quality through a mix of manual and automated testing.
   

  

* InDesign Workflow: Structured release cycle with ~12 planned deployments annually, requiring both manual and automated regression testing to ensure stability and reliability.
* Digital One Workflow: Runs on a Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) model, requiring robust automated testing for continuous validation and fast feedback loops.


 Since our automation efforts are in the early stages, you will help design and implement the foundations of our automation strategy and scale it to support both workflows.
   

  

**Who Are You**
 You are passionate about automation and quality assurance, and you thrive on ensuring stability and reliability through smart automation strategies. You are curious, creative, and always looking to expand test coverage and improve efficiency.Collaboration is key in this role, and you bring an open, straightforward, and professional style to teamwork, while also being self-driven and capable of setting up new structures and routines when needed. You enjoy working closely with the team while keeping automation at the core of your approach. Above all, you have a strong focus on delivering user value at scale.
   

  

* Set up and expand automated test frameworks (Playwright for UI, API automation).
* Build and maintain automated regression suites, starting with priority areas.
* Support both CI/CD (Digital One) and scheduled releases (InDesign) with the right balance of automation and manual testing.
* Report clear, structured bug reports and manage test accounts/data.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to embed quality in the development process.
* Drive continuous improvements in QA tools, processes, and standards.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Quality Assurance, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar.
* Proven hands-on experience as a QA Automation Engineer, with strong skills in:
+ Playwright for UI automation
+ API testing
+ CI/CD-driven automation frameworks
+ Cross-platform/browser automation (Mac, Windows, Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari)

* Strong ability to design scalable, maintainable automated test suites.
* Familiarity with Jira or similar issue tracking systems.
* Excellent communication skills in English and ability to work in an international environment.


 Nice to have:
   

  

* Experience with Fonto / XML-based applications.
* Familiarity with XBRL workflows.


**What We Offer**
 Founded 25 years ago, we have the stability and expertise of an established company—but at our core, we are entrepreneurial, fast-moving, and constantly evolving. We are on an exciting growth journey, expanding our reach and continuously innovating to stay at the forefront of corporate reporting.
   

  

 Join CtrlPrint, a progressive, inclusive company that values integrity, collaboration, and continuous development. We provide a competitive compensation package, benefits, and a flexible workplace, encouraging all employees to contribute meaningfully to our growth and success.

title: Vision Software Engineer
description:
**DeLaval Is Looking For a Experienced Computer Vision Engineer**
 There are lots of opportunities for smart vision applications on a modern dairy farm. Today we supervise the condition of the cows and even control robots in real-time via vision. Tomorrow, we plan to do even more. Clever vision solutions will help farmers around the world to run their operations in a more efficient and environmentally friendly way.
   

  

 We are now looking for an experienced Computer Vision Engineer for our Data Science & Vision Team. This is a job where you clearly can see how your code will help the end customer every day. A trip to a farm now and then will also give you a better understanding of the environment and the problems we have to solve.
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Develop and maintain computer vision applications for the dairy industry
* Take part in Proof-of-Concept studies and innovation projects
* Evaluate new technologies and tools in the area of computer vision
* Continuously develop and refine our way of working with vision technology


**Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in Engineering Physics, Computer Science or similar
* Experience from working with product development in industrial companies
* C++ and OpenCV
* Computer Vision experience – preferrable both traditional- and model-based image processing
* Knowledge about cameras, optics and illumination for computer vision
* Embedded system experience is a plus
* Experience from robotic applications is a plus
* Embedded systems experience is a plus
* Ability to communicate in Swedish


**Personal Competences**
* Collaborative mind-set
* Ability to excel in an agile small team environment
* Curiosity and out-of-the-box thinking
* Not afraid of getting hands dirty on a dairy farm from time to time


**We offer you**
 An opportunity to work with vision applications in a creative and dedicated team with end-to-end responsibility.
   

  

 An exciting position at the forefront of technology in a market leading company with customers all over the world.
   

  

 A possibility to work with software development and vision technology in a different and fun area of application, where you solve real world problems and clearly can see the result of your work.
   

  

 The position will be located in Tumba, Stockholm, and reports to Björn Wiklander, Manager Data Science & Vision Technology. The job may occasionally require some travel to test farms, in Sweden and abroad.
   

  

 Welcome with your application (in English)! We will review applications continuously. The last day to apply is December 20.
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at www.delavalcorporate.com .

description:

-

**Meritorious**

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

title: Data Engineer
description:
*We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*
*At Strawberry, we're not just a hotel company - we're building a universe of experiences. We're transforming the hospitality landscape through innovation and technology, and 2023 marked a major milestone with the launch of our new mother brand, Strawberry.*
 We are now looking for a talented
 **Data Engineer** 
 to join our central
 *Business Intelligence team* 
 in Technology. You'll be at the heart of everything that happens at Strawberry, working to design, build, and optimize our data warehouse and analytics ecosystem. Your work will be critical in transforming raw data into actionable insights, providing the high-quality, scalable datasets that empower business decisions, analytics, and application development across the company.
   

  

**Are you passionate about AI in data?**
 We are passionate about artificial intelligence (AI) and its potential to transform how businesses make data-driven decisions. Our team actively explores and provides the data foundation for AI-powered tools and models. If you’re excited about leveraging AI to push the boundaries of traditional BI, you’ll fit right in.
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Take ownership of the design, implementation, and maintenance of scalable and performant data models in Snowflake using dbt.
* Develop, maintain, and optimize data pipelines and ELT workflows with proper orchestration flows from sources into data warehouse solutions.
* Design and build data models in Snowflake leveraging dbt for transformations and version control.
* Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
* Write efficient Python scripts for data manipulation, automation, and integration with external APIs.
* Take a keen interest in owning the documentation for our data models and pipelines to ensure clarity and maintainability.
* Collaborate closely with data analysts, engineers, business teams, and source system owners to integrate new data and deliver powerful datasets for reporting and analytics.
* Deploy and maintain solutions within our Azure cloud environment.
* Support in the analysis of incidents, problem-solving, and bug fixes, managing support cases and hotfixes as needed.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data architecture, documentation, and development standards.


**What You'll Bring:**
* A minimum of 5-6 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, or a similar BI Developer role.
* Strong proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex and efficient queries.
* Proven experience with data modeling, back-end architecture, and data warehousing, specifically with Snowflake.
* Hands-on experience with modern data stack tools like dbt, and familiarity with orchestration tools like Airflow or Matillion.
* Solid Python scripting skills for data manipulation and automation.
* A understanding of data analysis, data visualization best practices, and storytelling techniques.
* A good grasp of data governance, version control (Git), and CI/CD principles.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
* An analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude and the ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication, active listening, and collaboration skills. You are a team player who builds trust, acts without prestige, and can establish strong relationships.
* Excellent command of English, both written and oral.
* A BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field.


**What We Offer:**
* Real Impact: Be a part of a dynamic transformation and contribute directly to our success story.
* Empowerment: Work in a flat organization with trust, autonomy, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
* Growth & Development: Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
* Fun & Community: Enjoy a vibrant work environment with plenty of social events and team-building activities.
* Fantastic Perks: Benefit from great employee discounts, including staff and friends & family rates at our hotels.
* Flexible Work: Enjoy the best of both worlds with our hybrid model, with three days of in-person collaboration at our Oslo or Stockholm HQ


 We do not offer remote positions; candidates must be located in or willing to relocate to Oslo or Stockholm.
   

  

 Ready to shape the future of hospitality with data? Apply today – we are reviewing applications continuously!

title: QA Software Engineer
description:
Are you an experienced Quality Assurance professional ready to take on a new challenge? We are looking for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team responsible for managing equipment through an online service. Your work will be key to help your team to deliver high quality applications as we continue to grow.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Create & Execute Test Plans: Develop detailed test plans based on product requirements and business needs, ensuring thorough execution of tests across all stages of development.
* Visualize Quality: Work closely with development teams to provide visibility into the quality of the software through metrics, dashboards, and regular status reports.
* Automate Tests: Drive the automation of manual tests to improve efficiency and coverage, contributing to the continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline.
* Ensure Comprehensive Requirement Coverage: Validate that all product requirements are thoroughly tested, ensuring high coverage and no critical gaps in testing.
* Test Data Management: Coordinate and ensure the availability of appropriate test data in various environments to facilitate accurate and thorough testing.
* Collaboration: Collaborate with developers, product managers, and other teams to define quality objectives.


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience of Quality Assurance with automation of test or equivalent within software development.
* Proficiency in writing automated tests using scripting and object oriented programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, Java or similar.
* Strong knowledge of test automation tools (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright etc.) and CI/CD pipelines.
* Hands-on experience in creating test plans, and test cases in agile environments.
* Strong understanding of requirement analysis and ensuring end-to-end quality coverage.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work well under pressure.
* Experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.) and cross-functional team collaboration.
* Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
* Familiarity with cloud environments and testing in cloud-based platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.).
* ISTQB certified.


**Bonus Skills (optional)**
* Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner).
* Experience with API testing tools (e.g., Postman, REST Assured, JMeter).
* Knowledge of security testing and practices.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behavior. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviors: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year.
* Private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely; however, employees are expected to be in the office at least three days per week.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Magnus Storbjörk, magnus.storbjork@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Senior Android engineer
description:
We are seeking a Senior Android Consultant to provide expert guidance and support in Android development projects. As a Senior Android Consultant, you will leverage your deep expertise in Android development to architect, design, and implement solutions that drive business value and deliver exceptional user experiences.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Conduct comprehensive code audits and analysis to identify areas of inefficiency, architectural and code weaknesses, contributing to the sustenance burden and technical debt.
* Hands on bug-fixing, prioritising high-impact issues, and establishing sustainable processes for ongoing bug triage and resolution
* Implement robust testing strategies, including automated testing frameworks, continuous integration pipelines, and regression testing suites, to prevent regression issues and reduce bug recurrence.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and stakeholders to advocate for investment in technical debt reduction initiatives and communicate the business value of addressing sustainability concerns.
* Measure the effectiveness of bug reduction and technical debt reduction efforts, track progress over time, and demonstrate tangible improvements in application stability and maintainability.


**Requirements:**
* 5+ years of professional experience in Android development, with a strong command of Java/Kotlin skills & knowledge of multi-threaded, asynchronous code.
* Experience in working with RESTful APIs, JSON parsing, and data serialisation formats like Protobuf
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel)
* Proficiency with version control systems like Git
* Strong debugging skills to identify and fix bugs, memory leaks, and other issues


 Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality, and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing
   

  

 Start: ASAP
   

  

 Length: 6 months
   

  

 Workplace: Stockholm, 1-2 days on site per week.

title: Javautvecklare till SPP
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens integrationslösningar i en verksamhet som verkligen gör skillnad?* 
 Hos SPP Tech kombinerar vi innovation med hållbarhet och moderna tekniker för att skapa framtidens digitala lösningar. Teamet
 **Core & Integrations** 
 söker nu en
 **Javautvecklare** 
 – här blir du en del av ett engagerat team som ansvarar för företagets integrationslager, navet som kopplar samman interna system.
 



  





 Just nu pågår en spännande modernisering där både plattform och integrationer flyttas till Azure, och som Javautvecklare får du en central roll i det arbetet. Du kommer också att vara med och utveckla integrationer mot externa system. Här jobbar du nära arkitekter, utvecklare och andra team, med stor möjlighet att påverka och ta ansvar i en miljö där samarbete står i fokus.
 



  





**I rollen kommer du att:** 



* Utveckla, förbättra och förvalta integrationer mot SPP:s interna system
* Arbeta med parprogrammering och kodgranskning för att säkerställa hög kvalitet
* Vara delaktig i vår molnresa och jobba med moderna cloudtjänster i Azure
* Ha möjlighet att påverka val av verktyg, tekniker och arbetssätt



 Vi jobbar målstyrt och agilt med ett starkt fokus på ständiga förbättringar – både i våra lösningar och i hur vi samarbetar. Du uppmuntras till kontinuerligt lärande genom kurser, föreläsningar och interna Lunch & Learn-sessioner där vi delar kunskap och inspirerar varandra.
 



  





**Och vem är då du?** 




 Eftersom du kommer att samarbeta med både ditt eget och andra utvecklingsteam inom SPP Tech är det viktigt att du är kommunikativ både på svenska och engelska. Du trivs med att dela kunskap, lösa problem tillsammans och bidra till en öppen och prestigelös teamkultur.
 



  





**Utöver detta ser vi gärna att du har:** 




 ✔ Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling
 



 ✔ Stark bakgrund inom Javautveckling
 



 ✔ Vana att arbeta i moderna cloudmiljöer och med containerbaserad infrastruktur
 



 ✔ Eftergymnasial utbildning inom systemutveckling eller liknande område
 



  





**Vår teknikstack är primärt:** 



* Java (Maven/Gradle), Spring Boot och Apache Camel
* GitHub Actions och CI/CD-pipelines
* SQL
* Testdriven utveckling (TDD)
* Azure som molnplattform, inklusive Azure Service Bus
* Inom en snar framtid: Docker och Kubernetes



  





**Att vara anställd på SPP** 




 Vi tror på balans, trygghet och långsiktighet – både i arbetslivet och privat. Därför erbjuder vi ett generöst förmånspaket som främjar hälsa, flexibilitet och framtid.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka in din ansökan genom länken
 **här.** 
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Ants, så sök tjänsten via deras jobbportal.
 



 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta gärna rekryteringsansvarig Sofia Odeen på sofia.odeen@ants.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande – så vänta inte med din ansökan!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Vi är en del av norska Storebrand, tillsammans är vi en av Nordens ledande koncerner för sparande och försäkringslösningar. Vi utmärker oss bland annat genom vårt fokus på hållbarhet och ansvarsfulla investeringar.
 



  





*Med kandidatens samtycke görs en bakgrundskontroll under anställningsprocessens slutskede som innebär kontroll av personalia, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor. Även CV och annan ansökningsdokumentation kan komma att verifieras.*

title: Senior Consulting Engineer -Stockholm
description:
**About Neo4j**
 Neo4j is the leader in Graph Database & Analytics, helping organizations uncover hidden patterns and relationships across billions of data connections deeply, easily, and quickly. Customers use Neo4j to gain a deeper understanding of their business and reveal new ways of solving their most pressing problems. Over 84% of Fortune 100 companies use Neo4j, along with a vibrant community of 250,000+ developers, data scientists, and architects across the globe.
   

  

 At Neo4j, we’re proud to build the technology that powers breakthrough solutions for our customers. These solutions have helped NASA get to Mars two years earlier, broke the Panama Papers for the ICIJ, and are helping Transport for London to cut congestion by 10% and save $750M a year. Some of our other notable customers include Intuit, Lockheed Martin, Novartis, UBS, and Walmart.
   

  

 Neo4j experienced rapid growth this year as organizations looking to deploy generative AI (GenAI) recognized graph databases as essential for improving it’s accuracy, transparency, and explainability. Growth was further fueled by enterprise demand for Neo4j’s cloud offering and partnerships with leading cloud hyperscalers and ecosystem leaders. Learn more at neo4j.com and follow us on LinkedIn.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.
   

  

 As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.
   

  

**The Role**
 Neo4j is the world’s leading graph database, and our Sales Engineering team are the people who help customers realize its value every day. Neo4j has proven to be the go-to data management solution in use cases such as Fraud Detection, Knowledge Graphs, Recommendation and personalisation, Risk management, Security, IT Management and Network Operations and many more.
   

  

 In the Neo4j Sales Engineering team, we are technologists who enjoy working directly with customers in a variety of industries, and with a wide range of technologies and architectures. We provide engineering and architecture leadership and development for the Neo4j-based solutions our customers are building.
   

  

 The responsibilities of a Sales Engineer cover a variety of tasks starting from understanding the prospective customers needs and environment, transforming the needs into an architecture including our leading-edge graph database technology and guiding all involved parties through the sales process. Demonstrating Neo4j as a technology for specific domains, whiteboarding solution architectures, and engaging at the level of technical decision makers are examples of the day-by-day work. The Sales Engineer understands business terminology, thinks in technical terms and combines both sides during the entire engagement.
   

  

 In addition to being Graph Database experts, you will need to understand and position other architectural components in a graph-based solution, such as Big Data platforms, other NoSQL stores, relational databases, caching, messaging and middleware services taking part in a Modern Data Architecture.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Working with our customers’ teams, you’ll lead and contribute to all phases of the Neo4j PreSales projects
* Be an integral part of the Neo4j sales team, helping to persuade prospective Neo4j users of the benefits and advantages of graph database technology
* Position the Neo4j technology within the customer’s environment and architecture
* Discuss solution architectures with our customers to address the technical requirements of our customers’ projects
* Design and build prototype solutions that demonstrate required functionality with Neo4j
* Help prepare solution proposals for our customer’s engineering and management teams that help address the overall project goals


**What You'll Bring**
* 5+ years working in a PreSales or Professional Services Organization
* Excellent understanding and demonstrable experience with database technologies and data modelling concepts, ideally with NoSQL stores.
* Architecture skills - ie mapping a business to technical requirements and understanding multiple components to build a solution
* Software engineering experience.
* Familiarity with at least one programming language (Java, Python, Javascript)
* Ability to engage and interact with engineers in an advisory roleComfortable and quick with learning new technologies as needed
* Passionate about solving technical problems
* Capable of educating and training small groups
* Strong understanding of the sales process
* A proactive approach to keeping the technical aspects of a sales process on track
* Industry vertical experience in one of: Financial Services, Retail, Government, Security or Pharmaceutical, Supply Chain, Manufacturing.
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills
* Ability to work independently, self-directed and remotely in a cross functional organization
* Ability and willingness to travel


**Nice To Have**
* Graph DB related experience ie Neo4j or other Property Graph or RDF platforms.
* Data Science, AI/MLData integration: ETL, Virtualisation, federation
* BI and data visualization (Tableau, Qlik, viz libraries: D3, viz.js, Linkurious...)

title: Provcellsingenjör/ Test Bed Engineer
description:
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
**Är du en lagspelare med passion för teknik, fordon och framtidens drivlinor? Då kan du vara den vi söker!**
 Vi söker dig som trivs med varierande arbetsuppgifter – både praktiska och teoretiska – och som vill vara en del av utvecklingen av morgondagens teknik. Just nu söker vi provcellsingenjörer till våra anläggningar i Södertälje och Haninge.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi kontaktar och intervjuar kandidater allt eftersom ansökningarna kommer in – vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan!
   

  

 I rollen som provcellsingenjör kommer du att arbeta nära både teknik och kund. Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Förberedelse, installation och övervakning av provobjekt
* Kalibrering, service och underhåll av provobjekt och provcell
* Kvalitetssäkring och analys av provdata
* Konfiguration av mätsystem – både hårdvara och mjukvara
* Systematisk felsökning och dokumentation
* Praktiskt arbete med provobjekt och testutrustning
* Godshantering och logistik
* Identifiering och rapportering av avvikelser
* Daglig kontakt och samarbete med kund


**Profilbeskrivning**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:
   

  

* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team
* En stark vilja att utvecklas och lära dig nytt
* Erfarenhet av praktiskt mekaniskt arbete med fordon, maskiner eller liknande
* Förståelse för vikten av att följa processer och rutiner, men också förmåga att lösa problem på egen hand
* Ett kvalitetsmedvetet arbetssätt och intresse för förbättringsarbete
* God teknisk förståelse för drivlinor
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* Möjlighet att arbeta enligt skiftschema (2-, 3- eller 4-skift)
* B-körkort (krav)


**Meriterande**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant tekniskt område
* Erfarenhet av provning eller utveckling i kontrollerad miljö


**Vi Erbjuder**
* Vi erbjuder dig en omväxlande roll med ett stort eget ansvar.
* Ett personligt onboarding koncept för att hjälpa dig att komma in i verksamheten.
* Kollektivavtal, försäkringar och förmånspaket med friskvårdsbidrag etc.


**Intresserad?**
 Skicka genast in din online ansökan till AVL!
   

  

 Andreas Andersson
   

  

 Andreas.Andersson@avl.com
